user_text: Attended a great birthday party here for my friend Vicki. The place is the beautifully decorated. Unfortunately, it snowed the night of our visit and a number of friends canceled at the last minute, but the group of us who attended had a very nice time.I don't know how thrilled the birthday girl and her family were with the second table being taken away due to the cancellations, especially since they had already paid for that number of attendees.  We could have used some extra room because were were shoehorned in pretty tightly. I think there were about 15 of us all together, and had one long table placed up against one of the corner, circular booths. The food was served family style with large platters that were brought out by servers. They would put things on everyone's plate and then leave the rest on the table so we could pick. The appetizers alone were very filling. I loved the chicken, the lamb chops were great, and the hummus & baba ghanouj were nicely done. One of the appetizers was a crab cake that was put on my plate before I could ask if it had crab, so I was a little ticked about that. I tried to ask and the server walked away. The woman next to me tasted it, said "yeah, it's crab."  I can handle my allergy but give me a second to ask. The nurse sitting across from me grabbed my plate and handed me her clean plate in exchange. We were told the belly dancers would be out at 9 but they didn't go on until sometime between 10:30 & 11. Once the show started you really couldn't leave because you'd be in the way, so I felt a bit captive at that point. The guy in charge said it was because of the snow but someone else said this happens all the time - they wait for the place to fill up with a late-drinking crowd.So, food is good, management seems a bit disinterested, I won't judge based on how they did or didn't handle the party since the birthday lady's family was handling that, and it does look like a nice place for a romantic time out. I'd go again, I think, but there are other Middle Eastern places I like more.

Where else in Manhattan can you get top notch food paired with great entertainment (belly dance show followed by live DJ music), impeccable service and great decor? That's why I picked Casa La Femme for my 30th birthday to celebrate with my 10 girlfriends. The manager Ameer went above and beyond to accommodate all my asks. He's the nicest and the most patient person! I was so nervous something would go wrong, but wow, did they surpass my expectations?! The food was amazing, we loved the belly dancer and he DJ played great music for us at the end of the evening to we could shake it up. Can't go wrong with Casa La Femme. Don't let the negative reviews stop you from experiencing this truly hidden gem! You'll love it.

I came here on the 16th of March as a birthday celebration. Overall I thought the food, the show [bellydancers] and environment  was great... they were even nice when we told them we were only going to be 15 mins late of our reservation. Inside is beautiful. The only complain I have is how long it took them to take out our food. I'm not kidding you...we arrived at 845 and didn't leave until like 1230 because that is how long it took w bring each course out. We got the pixie course and the food was delicious. The drinks were on point. Overall good experience.

One star because the ambiance was nice and the belly dancers are entertaining . Other then that don't waste your time. Poorly managed, service is horribly, food is overpriced for portion sizes. Worst group birthday Dinner experience I've ever experienced.
Been here many times, most recently for a birthday dinner and the service, entertainment, food and music were all fantastic.Probably my favorite place in NYC. Highly recommend.

I've been coming here for 10 years, and I've always had a great time!The waitstaff is professional, know the menu inside and out, and will make spot on recommendations when asked.Food is really tasty, and close to being authentic, without having any extreme spice. On my last visit, they were very accommodating when I needed to switch the time of my reservation. However, they told me that the belly dancer would be coming at a specific time, so I booked my reservation around that. When I was almost done with our meal, and saw that there was only one other  table beside mine, I asked about the dancer. Was told she would be coming out in an hour. Since I have been told over the phone several times that the performance  is at a specific time every night, I wondered if they delayed her dancing, in order to get more tips. Which leads me to my next point:Warning : highly recommend coming without children. It's a quiet, Romantic vibe here, with a nightly belly dance show that can include quite an eyeful, and the dancer usually has dollar bills tucked into her skirt/belt... fine for adult audiences, but I prefer not to have little ones getting into the habit of tipping dancing girls a dollar at a time.

Amazing food and service. I don't understand the bad reviews. This place hits on all the marks: great food, drinks and ambiance. I was blown away by the decor. I would recommend getting the prix fixe menu for $60 per person. Our server Joseph went above and beyond and was very accommodating to my large group. I had the best birthday dinner. I definitely recommend for a special occasion or impressing a date.

The worst group dinner experience I have ever had in my entire life! Food was mediocre, it took 20 minutes for a glass of water, 50 minutes for our first round of alcoholic beverages to be delivered, a long ordering process which lead to a long wait for our food which arrived with several mistakes and they lost my birthday cake for a while. There's not enough staff, alcohol and fruit. They ran out of drink ingredients, fruit garnish and champagne.  It was so excruciating most of my guests called it an early night as did I. I had to go through my bill w the manager and stand over him to make corrections. Be warned- don't celebrate anything important here.

They even have belly dancers come to dance in this restaurant. I came here with my boyfriend, and we enjoyed the hummus platter, as well as the show. The dancer was so beautiful and skilled. She balanced candles on her head and also her legs even! It was incredible.

I will recommend everyone try this place once because I'll definitely be back. I took myBoyfriend for his birthday dinner & he was super appreciative. We had the best time ever!

Aesthetically a beautiful place, especially now that they have redesigned the venue for summer. Cons: I made a reservation, and still had to wait nearly 10 minutes before I was seated... despite the place being empty. Be prepared to pay for basic things... such as still water (that should come to the table free of charge because it's from the tap), and pita. Another con is I was handed a prix fixe menu when an a la carte menu was available. I feel like the entire time I was trying to be upsold on everything I asked about on the menu. This is not the experience I was expecting... and not in a good way. There is a relatively good variety of menu options. I'm vegan so it's difficult to eat out sometimes... I suggest asking for the yogurt sauce (garnish) be removed from mezza platters. As beautiful as the ambiance and authentic decor is, I probably will not visit again. The staff wasn't very welcoming and they seemed preoccupied with selling the highest price items.

Such a beautiful and romantic restaurant. They have fresh grass on the floor of the restaurant which is changed every week which is very unique. Belly dancing every night at 9.30pm or so. Carlos the manager made our night special by being very attentive to our needs. We had the 4 course Prix Fixe Menu.  Starter was the trio of mezzos of hummus, babaganoush and fuul medames. All were great but loved the babaganoush and hummus the best.Appetizers were crabmeat kofta and felfel mashi. Both were flavorful and tasty. Loved both but the crabmeat kofta was my favorite.Entrees were salmon mashway and samek mashway which was the branzino. The branzino was definitely my favorite. It was cooked with onions tomato and basil. So light and flaky it melted in your mouth. Salmon was excellent too.Egyptian style french fries are a must try. They are seasoned with sumac which is out of this world.We also got the basboussa and baklava for dessert. Baklava was light and crispy. Basboussa with ice cream was creamy and had a hint of coconut.

As soon as we sat down the waitress was annoying and kept trying to make us buy and order more than what we wanted (she even told us to stop ordering pita for our mezzas because then we won't order entrees)....and then we saw them charge another table for extra items that were actually supposed to be on our bill, and the other table didn't notice....but we ended up having to pay for our items anyway so the restaurant made double. VERY sketchy, and even as we were getting up another waitress tried to make us stay and order dessert and after we said no we saw her leave and whisper something to the manager. I just got a weird vibe after leaving there and I don't think I'll go back again, which is a shame because the food was decent.

The belly dancer was really good and she danced around to every table individually and even encouraged some diners to dance with her. Parking was easy. Cons: I think this is slightly over priced.

The food was subpar and the service was comically awful. Sorry, I won't be visiting again.

Amazing. Amazing. Amazing.This was my best kept secret last summer until I made the mistake of bringing friends! Haha but anyway, this is our go-to downtown spot.Depending on the time of year and day, the ambience varies. I've come in the middle of summer, stretched out on the grass floor (yes, GRASS floor), drank beers and watched soccer. Or, on a Friday or Saturday night we'll get dressed up for girls night and have a fabulous meal and dessert. The decor is very feminine and Egyptian boho glam (with out being gaudy or tacky). The male to female ratio is about 1:2. Bathrooms are plentiful, single, spacious (clean AND pretty) rooms. Desserts are top notch and I have so many favorite foods I can't list them all, but please get the crab cake!!! The best I've had in my life, and I've been almost everywhere. Basically, there are more enough good things I can say about this place. Oh, and also... Nicklas - our server last time, you deserve a medal!!

We couldn't have asked for a more romantic evening.

Service was incredibly slow, which didn't quite make sense on a non-busy night. But even with all the hiccups, we really enjoyed the décor, the food and the belly dancer (though we wish "the show" lasted more than 15 minutes).

Had a fun time casa la femme last night.  The hosts and servers were super nice and inviting, but did seem a bit unorganized.  When we came in for an 830 pm dinner, there were not very many people there and several tables open.  We were seated about 10 mins after we got there.  Then, we were asked by 3 separate waiters about which type of water we wanted.  We decided to get the fixed menu and the food was great! One issue though...they took my husbands order down incorrectly and he ended up getting the right meal after we were all almost done eating.  Lastly, the drinks were awesome and the decor was beautiful! The belly dancing show was short, but it was fun!

Dinner with a show! Belly dancing time! Can't wait to show these bitches how it's done but first drinks please Oh the food is yummy.. Crab cakes have chunks of shrimp and crab  can we get any better then that!?

Management called to cancel our confirmed reservations for a private event last minute. Leaving us with no plans for a birthday celebration.Can't comment on food or performance since this establishment has no problem not honoring reservations (made for a birthday in advance!!)

If you haven't been to this spot, you are surely missing out.  It is a nice oasis from the city life and it feels like you are in paradise.  They have large windows that are opened in the summer and much to my suprise there was a woman with a dog sitting in one of the outdoor table areas.  The place has a belly dancer that comes on a 9:30pm and she was quite entertaining. The food for prix fix was a great deal. The ambiance is so beautiful, you can tell they spared no detail. Will definitely be back!

This place is amazing.. do not listen to the bad reviews they do not know how 4 course meals goes! I came here with my bf with a Groupon that included a starter, appetizer, entree & dessert. Once I arrived I sat down immediately, your automatically start with 3 hummus dips & pita bread, all were so fresh & warm nothing like store brand that I'm use too lol. As an appetizer I got the salad & my date got the crab cake, the crab cake was amazing and had ceviche salsa on top with gave it a extra kick. For entree I had the fish of the day (branzino) my date had the salmon everything was cooked to perfection! To end the meal off right we had a coconut cake with ice cream & little pastries on the side. I love that fact that they do not rush the courses & give you time to enjoy the actual courses! They also have live belly dances at 9:30pm & on the weekend its twice night. Will definitely come back & enjoy this laid back experience.

Hosted a birthday party at Casa La Femme with a big group over the weekend. Everything from the custom menu to the very attentive staff and the friendly bartender helped make it a wonderful experience. After a delicious meal we moved over to the bar and enjoyed everything from the hookahs and the belly dancer. If you find yourself in the West  Village, you should definitely drop in!

We came here for our office holiday dinner party at 6:30 and did not leave until almost midnight so yes you can say we had a great time! Great food and the belly dancing was a plus! Awesome atmosphere and Amir was extremely attentive! Must come back again!!

I really really wanted to fall in love with this place, but actually feel ripped off. I made a reservation though open table for 6pm because they claimed they had a belly dancer show at 7:15pm and 9:15pm. Took my friend to the 2pm show of Aladdin for her birthday and said there no better place to take her for dinner than to this place that fits the theme. First they kept changing the time of my reservation throughout the three weeks. Then yesterday before arriving we called to confirm the show time. They said yes at 7:15. When you arrived you fall in love with the atmosphere of the place. Everything is lovely and elegant, its very romantic. We had asked to sit under one of the tents. In order to sit there you have to get the pre-fix 4 course meal for $60. Which sounds like a bargain but its not because almost everything we ordered had a surcharge. First it took about 25 minutes to get to order drinks, mine you they only had another couple there. Second the drinks taste like you were chewing on a lime had to ask to change it to another drink and they kept sending the wrong one back. The Pita and spread were delicious. 40 minutes later we got the apps. Both very tiny and definitely not worth it. The main course was decent but nothing out of this world but we are still waiting to be amazed by the show. Finally i gave up and asked the waiter when was it gonna start since it was well past the time of the first show. He looked at me confused and said "the first show starts at 9:15 but I will get the manager to come talk to you". When he came it was the same person who told us the show would start at 7:15. He said the dancer had a hard time getting to work and that it has to be cancelled. Complete bull. Since they were not busy enough they decided to cancel as a friend who goes there a lot let me know. They only do the show when they have a full house. Then to top it all off the waiter asked if we really wanted our last course which was desert. YES didn't we have to get a four course meal. Definitely not worth it for a 230 dollar dinner. Portions are small. The staff take 30-40 minutes between coming to your table. The only thing good I can say is that even though the waiter seemed lost he tired to assist in making us better.

Horrible experience. Dined here with a group for a birthday. To start off the service was so bad!! The waiter only brought half of the table water, then we could never get him to return to the table. It took us 45 mins to get our order in, then they forgot to bring it to us. The guys at the table actually got up walked over to the server area, took the jug of water and served the table. Decor is nice food was good.
Cada la femme, definitively surpass my expectation. A Must visit place. Food and service were excellent, maria our waitress was the best always attentive and courteous

This place was great!  I came here over the weekend for the Egyptian bellydancing dinner from Groupon.  It was a little empty when I first came in (around 6pm) but by 7pm, it was pretty crowded.For some reason, they weren't serving cocktails that night and only wine which was fine so my friend and I opted for a bottle.  The service was very professional.  They all knew what they were doing and I believe the manager, Luis (?) even stopped by a few times to make sure everything was going smoothly.We had the 4 course dinner and got the:- mezza (soo good!  We were a huge fan of the fava bean dip)- crab cake (this was a little disappointing.  Definitely a lot of crab flavor but nothing else really)- sausage slider (my friend thought this was really good but it was so small - it wasn't called a slider but looked like a slider so I'm calling it a slider)- we both got the lamb chops.  SO GOOD.  The meat was tender and the rice was cooked in a lot of garlic and possibly pork fat and skin because there were these chunks of that in the rice and it was SO GOOD.  I'm pretty sure my friend and I polished off the rice within a few minutes.  - the chef's selection for the dessert.  I wasn't terribly impressed with this.My friend definitely wants to go back again at some point but I'm not sure if the $60/person for the 4 course meal is worth it.  The Groupon was definitely worth it for me though.  Maybe I'll go a la carte next time.The bellydancing was interesting as well.  It wasn't too long - probably 30 mins or so and she went around dancing with a few of the customers (my friend included lol)

Had a stunningly exquisite experience tonight at Casa La Femme. It was my first time dining at the restaurant but hopefully not my last. I definitely recommend the prix fixe menu. For $60, you get four delicious courses and each were made to perfection. The food was spectacularly good; absolutely the best baba-ghanouj I've ever tasted, delicious hummus, tasty salata tamatam, and delectable vegetarian moussaka. On top of that, everyone at the restaurant was amazing from the host Carlos, to my server Tom, to bartenders Candy and Christian, everyone was friendly, knowledgeable, efficient, and made me feel valued and welcome. Kudos and thank you to the staff and chef for giving me a delicious and memorable meal. I look forward to dining here again!
The food was good. The portion ok.  But this was the worst service I have ever had (that a lot for NY). The waiters should slow down their attitude.

Food was great and the staff were really attentive, Luis was an exceptional manager after our meal he brought us champagne. We got the pre-fix meal on groupon and we had the crab cakes and filet salmon with couscous #delicioso #yumyum A bit pricey but everything else was great!
Unbelievably flavorful.  Every bite a Middle Eastern excursion.  I recommend the set menu.  A tour of great tastes!

Casa La Femme offers a wide variety of great Egyptian food, food is as good as in Egypt or any other Eastern Mediterranean country. The restaurant offers a nice atmosphere and has a belly dancing show at night, which I really enjoyed. The service was super good, Mariam our waitress gave great recommendations and delightfully served us, shout out to Mariam!

4 stars for the decor of the place as it transports you to Morocco. 4 stars for the food. The Branzino was perfectly cooked and seasoned. 2 stars for the seating arrangement. Reservations were made well in advance. There is no reason why the party was separated seated perpendicularly with tables that didn't even match. 1 star for the service. One waitress was training another and she didn't even know her name. When we placed our orders, she repeated each of our orders twice and she still didn't get it right. Orders were being placed all over. The kitchen incorrectly gave me salmon versus the Branzino. When we paid for the bill, the nitwit forgot to charge a card and got so frustrated she slammed the pitcher of water and asked the manager to take care of it. Little did she know, it was her fault. So yeah... I'm never coming back here again.

Had one of the worst restaurant experiences of my life here yesterday.My friend and I walked in here randomly to have a couple drinks and some small plates on their outside swinging chairs (it was completely empty save for one table at 7pm, which maybe should have been a warning sign). As I was chewing the second bite of our order of squid I suddenly feel a poke in my cheek. I reach into my mouth and pull out not one but two thin pieces of shredded metal, about a toothpick in length and thickness. I immediately walk into the restaurant and inform the manager. He hands me a napkin and asks me to give it to him so he can go to the kitchen and check it out (I have zero clue what this was supposed to accomplish). A few minutes later he returns and informs me that he checked the kitchen, that nothing is amiss in there and that this metal must have fallen from the construction platforms overhead us (seriously how dumb do you think we are?). Furthermore, he proudly states that they have taken the squid off our bill (no kidding buddy, we ate four bites of it and sent it back, do you seriously think you're doing us a favor by taking it off the bill?). I ask him if that's the only thing he is going to take care of due to our experience, and he says yes; the conversation ends shortly after. My friend and I sit and stew for a few minutes about how inappropriate a response that is, and then my friend walks in to see if he can talk some sense into the manager. Shortly after the manager returns and says he will take off 25% of our bill. I laugh in his face and tell him no thanks, you guys clearly need it so just bring us the full bill and we will be on our way. His response is to request that we both put our 3/4 full drinks down and leave the property, and that if we do so he will not ask us to pay. I reply that I would love to do so, and stand up to walk away. At this point the manager walks up to me and starts accusing me of lying to him and scamming them. I got so upset and flustered at this accusation that I forgot to remind him that I *JUST* offered to pay 100% of the bill in response to his 25% discount offer, and basically just started yelling at him about how dare he etc etc. I've never been treated so rudely by a manager at any restaurant and have certainly never been accused of trying to scam a restaurant for a bill (a $60 check, no less). TLDR: found multiples pieces of sharp shredded metal in our order of squid. Manager tried to pretend the metal fell out of the sky and had nothing to do with his kitchen. First refuses to comp anything, then offers 25% off, I decline and say I'd rather pay the full bill, he then kicks us out of the restaurant and questions my integrity several times, outright calling me a scammer to my face.
The food is a B+. Desserts were delicious. Belly dancers talented. But after waiting hours for food and a table, the service is F---. More to update later.

I've lived in NYC all of my life and this has to be the worst dining experience ever, the food was disgusting, the service was the worst, the entertainment was dry and my whole part got food poisoning from the food ( it was undercooked) and did I say disgusting!   Dine at your own risk!

This is a hidden gem! It has a great vibe and great entertainment after 9pm.....don't forget to tip the girls who give you a classy show of belly dancing. The food is great we had the Prix Menu which is a great choice for good dining. Started off with their signature babagonoush.....excellent I recommend the Tamara, its small but filling can be shared for two. The Salmon Mashway was cooked to perfection, some places undercook salmon and leaves a fish taste but this one was just right. Complementary drinks from Amir was a nice touch! Mango martini delicious! Don't listen to the bad reviews it's obvious people don't know a good place when they see it.

Excellent service, friendly and helpful staff. Our waiter was attentive and one of the most professional servers I've ever had. The decor and the food was fantastic. I can't say enough positive things about Casa La Femme

Terrible experience. Overpriced. Horrible service. They charged $4 for a small soda and no free refills. $15 for a bar drink. The food was bite sized and not very good. The show was one dancer for 30 minutes and then nothing for 90 minutes. For a $200 dinner this is a definite run in the other direction.

My boyfriend took me here for a date night, loved the decor right away and was seated in a private tent. This spot is great for a date or even with a large group. Was greeted by the belly dancer as she danced with me before we sat down. We walked in while she was performing. We ordered the pre fixed menu which is $60 a person. The food was so delicious and fresh. The seafood dish and extra jumbo shrimps were great ! Getting hookah along with dinner just added to the Egyptian  atmosphere. The drinks were sweet, maybe would just stick to wine next time. We asked the waiter when the belly dancer was back on and he said 12 which we were out and done before 12 so we didn't get to see her total full performance. They charge for water which we weren't aware of and also change for extra pita bread. Would of been nice to know that prior to the check. But still despite that, my boyfriend and I had a very romantic and amazing dinner. We walked away so full and even had left overs to take home.

A few of us came here last Sat for my brother in laws bday. Our waiter Doug was fantastic and made sure we had a good time. His menu recommendations were excellent and on point. The belly dancer was very friendly and made sure she spent time at every table. Her performance is really short which is the only negative thing I can say about our entire experience. I will def go back to try more of the drink and food menu. I would also request Doug as my server since he has us laughing all night.
Excellent service. Thanks Carlos! Great entertainment, experience and ambience. Amazing food. Standouts.. Branzino, French Fries, Babaghanoush, Hummus, and so much more.

I came here last night for my best friend's birthday dinner. Kind of started off on a bad foot as we had to wait about 20 minutes past our reservation time and we were starving. Even when we got to our table it took a while for us to even get a waiter. They seemed to be a bit short staffed which was strange for a restaurant on a weekend. Nevertheless, the first course appetizers were great! The babagonoush is literally to die for! I would definitely recommended this place for vegetarians. I had a salad for the second course appetizer. It was nothing to write home about. The belly dancer came on at 10PM and she was amazing! So gorgeous and talented! She came over to our table and danced with my friend. She did a great job making her feel special on her birthday. The entree part wasn't so great for me. I ordered the tagine khodar which comes with couscous and a vegetable stew and all was well until about 5 minutes into eating it. I felt so sick that I wanted to pass out. There was definitely something in there that didn't agree with me. We took dessert to go as we were in a rush. Overall, I probably wouldn't come here again as I don't really feel as though I got my money's worth. The first course appetizers were delicious, but the rest of the food was definitely forgettable (besides the dish that made me feel sick!) I don't really feel that the level of service justifies the price.

I realize we picked an awful night, valentines, to try this place for the first time but it was a recommendation from a friend. First it was 150 dollars a head. Flat fee- pre fixe - standard new york city overpriced BS. We are used to this. But when we arrived to the mostly empty restaurant they sat my 6 foot 4 inch boyfriend and I at what can only be described as a toddler sized table. We arrived at 730 pm. They bring out a basket of bread and a very small cup of hummus. By 8:30 they had failed to bring out any of our actual food. Fail number one. The waiter was insistent and pushy about us ordering drinks, not included in the ridiculous price. He kept trying to guilt my boyfriend into getting wine etc . It was embarrassing. After several no thank you's he tried to guilt us again when i finally shut it down and ordered a hot tea.  We don't drink. Fail 2Finally our appetizers come out- child sized portions- of course because new york. But mine - the vegetarian option was at least hot. My poor boyfriends meat skewers were like icicles on a stick. He was so hungry at this point that he just ate it.Then they cleared our tiny table which was so small we had to finish our tea hastily to make room for the food we were waiting over an hour for. Then we wait some more. 15 minutes go by and the waiter comes over confused as to why we havent had our main course. They bring it out. Mine again is fine, my poor boyfriends is two ice cold lobster tail halves and a fist sized portion of cold pasta. He ate it anyway because at this point he had pre paid for this meal and he didnt want to ruin our valentines day. The desert was actually good. We wont be back.

This is the worst restaurant I've been to in NYC. It's a tourist trap. The food was terrible and over priced and the portions were tiny. The salad is a tiny lump of shaved carrot with lemon - $13. The crab cake was the tiniest I've ever seen and tasted more like shrimp, yet was $15 for 1???? The service was terrible. The moment we asked for an a la carte menu, the server gave us attitude. He didn't even bring us 1 for everyone - just 1 for the table. Idiot. I tried to be patient and understanding but he was a jackass who didn't fill our water and it was too hot in there. If a restaurant is that expensive the service should be impeccable. It was the worst. I ended up spending $70 and didn't leave full. The only thing I liked was the lamb. But still... $30 for three tiny pieces and no sides???? There are so many amazing restaurants in the city with great service and vibes... I'll never go back here again. Do yourself a favor and go to souvlaki gr instead which has good food, great prices, beautiful atmosphere.

We came here for my sister's birthday now the service was great the waitresses and the waiter accommodated our big group however when it came to the food everything was getting mixed up . it took them literally two hours for our dishes to come. The pita bread was fresh and on point; however the main courses were the issue. now people come for the lamb chops but I warn you not to come here for the lamb chops. The Lamb Chops were dry and boring!!! The chicken tasted simple for the price you would think it should blow your mind unfortunately that didn't happen!! So I give it three stars for the service honestly but for the food and the price I wouldn't come here again

Came here on March 26 as part of a group of 7 people.  The manager was extremely accommodating considering our group was an hour late.  My first complaint which isn't a big deal is that they pushed 2 tables together to accommodate our group but they were two different tables that were not the same height so that was a little odd.  The food was really tasty.  Nothing was spicy though.  We had a Groupon for a 4 course pre-fixed meal which was really only 2 courses.  The first course was warm pita bread with 3 different dipping sauces.  That should have just been a given.  Most places have some form of bread on the table while you wait for your meal.  That shouldn't have been considered "a course."  For my second course I had the Crabmeat Kofta (lump crabmeat, shrimp, leeks and scallions).  You taste more shrimp than crab.  Tasty either way.  Third course I had the Grilled Whole Fish of the day (Branzino).  Very tasty and meaty.  Nothing else was on the plate.  Just the fish.  Honestly would it have killed them to put a tiny portion of starch and/or vegetable on the plate?  I didn't stay for dessert but I heard it was 3 little mini "something's" that should not have been considered a course.The belly dancer was awesome!  On Saturday nights the belly dancer performs at 7:30 and then again at 9:30.  I would say her performance is about 30 minutes long.  She really engages with the crowd.  She moves through the room and invites diners to get up and dance with her by their table.  Everyone is into it.  The overall décor of this place is very romantic.  Love the bathrooms.  I would bring the hubby here if we were in the neighborhood.One last negative is that the courses took too long in between one another.  The service should have been a lot quicker.

Very expensive and not for a young crowed. The music sucked, belly dancer was horrible, and the staff was lost; I had to ask for my appetizer three times! Never will I ever go there again. Please save your money and go else where.

What a gem of a find! On September 2, 2017, I celebrated my birthday dinner at this restaurant with four girlfriends and what a blast we had!  From the moment you enter this establishment, you are entertained. The staff greets you like you are the star of the night, the bartenders and wait staff are real and engage with you the entire time!  And our dinner was incredibly tasty and like nothing I've ever tasted before!  Served hot, perfectly seasoned, insane presentation and colorful and imaginative dishes! Truly a culinary experience.  And if this wasn't enough, being a gluten free, vegan, I'm a nightmare to every wait staff so I always apologize in advance and ask them to just please make me anything that fits into this category as I don't want to be an added problem. Most places comply and throw something together, but not Casa La Femme, nope, when I asked for a dish minus the couscous, they instead replaced the couscous with delicious coconut rice...without me asking!!! And given that it was my birthday and my friends asked for a candle on  my desert, they, on their own, put a candle on a dish of fruit (which was not on the menu)!! I was so floored and touched by their attention to the smallest detail and how they went out of their way to make me, and each of my friends feel so special. Unbelievable. Now, lets get to the décor, in one word...GORGEOUS!  The restaurant design is one of which you expect I Dream of Jeanie was filmed, the grass on the floor took you out of New York City and into a vacation like setting and the bathrooms are ones like HGTV.I can't wait to go back here again and again and again. As for my gluten free, vegan main course of veggies in a tangine...WOW!!!! I wanted to lick the inside of that tangine. Thank you Casa La Femme for truly taking my birthday celebration to entirely new level that will stay in my memory for many years to come!Liz

As an Egyptian, I have to say this place is one of the most authentic experiences. Not just with the cuisine, but with ambiance, design, and entertainment. Theres an amazing belly dancer every night too! I've been to Egypt several times, and I can tell you that these dancers have the moves! Best in New York for sure.Great date spot, but try to get the tents for something a little more intimate. I'll definitely be back again and again and again. Its like a home away from home

Undoubtedly one of the worst dining experiences. To stay concise I helped plan a dinner for a friends birthday here and from beginning till end the management did not cease to disappoint. After agreeing to a prix-fixe price over the phone, we were told that we will have to pay about 30 dollars more per head upon arrival. I would not have minded if the food was even worth 30 dollars to begin with. The food was no better than the cheap stuff served in shady hookah lounges in the East Village. Next was the service, half the table was served and the other half waited an extra 20 mins before their dishes were brought out not to mention the three wrong orders and the attitude we received when letting the server know. The landlord should cancel their lease and let a real restaurant occupy the beautiful space these idiots are wasting.

Positives:* I carry great memories spent with friends and family here ...* Food is really good too, I have almost tried all their appetizers, esp I love the crab cakes* They even ask for your allergies and fix it..* I always had lamb chops and I loved it.* and ofcourse Belly dance.Negatives:* We had to wait for more than 30 mins to get dessert served. its a 3 hour trip we had, though we enjoyed its too much of time consumed.

The decor is beautiful and the belly dancers (short show) is very entertaining. Although the waiters/bus boys seem to be very trained "by the book", they seemed to lack common sense(if that makes sense). I was with a party of lets say 10, pre fix menu. When it was time for the main coarse everyone received their dishes. The person that sat next to me was given his food, and began to eat it. (It was suppose to be a seafood dish, which it was). It was his first time eating at the restaurant . About 15 minutes later , as most of his food was eaten either the manager or the waiter approached him accusing him of eating someone elses dish. Okay?? he did not know. In any case, this accusation was so rude , and I honestly was in shock. Although they gave the proper dish to the person which ordered it, the way they treated the person who accidently ate it was disgusting.Now the food:Dips -were okay.Chicken and rice- the chicken was bland, the rice was sour (from lemon juice?)I barely ate my food. It was not good in any way. I can get a much much better tsting meal 5 times cheaper in brooklyn. Thisfood did not have any middle eastern flavor whatsoever.Will not return.

Came here a second time. Our reservation was for 8pm. We got here at 8:20pm. I understand that we were late. They told us that they will get us the next available table. 80mins and no table later I am writing this 1 star review. You've let me down, Casa.

Ambiance is beautiful.. customer service is ok.. needs more staff.. appetizer are yummy! Bread hummus etc.. main entrees not that great! .. if u want a tent it's an extra $10.00.. hookah is over priced! Overall experience is ok

I've been here twice - both times on dates with different people. The first time I got to see the bellydancers perform (there were two of them) but we came on a Sunday and the restaurant was pretty much empty (maybe 2 other tables were occupied) so the atmosphere was lacking a little bit. The belly dancers did interact with us (they pulled both me and my date up at separate times and showed us a dance). The tables are arranged in a circular formation so that everyone can basically get a good view.The second time I went there were no belly dancers or show, so that was disappointing - and the restaurant was a little bit more crowded, making service a little less personalized.Both times I recall the food being good, albeit very expensive (we got the a la carte). I think the food I tried were: the baklava, crab cakes and some eggplant dish. The service was professional / fine and the bathroom was exceptionally clean and comfy. To be honest, the entire opulent decor of the restaurant is what makes this restaurant so special.Parking is really tight around here but it's a great date spot because you get to luxuriate behind curtains in your own little romantic nook.TIP: If you are on a date I'd recommend going on a romantic stroll to the water (just two or so blocks away) after dinner and making sure you book whenever the show will be on.

Horrible service. Bought a Groupon. Waited 45minutes for drinks. The food took forever and never made its way out unless we reminded the staff. The waiter was fired and the "manager" made it very clear. The waiter was very nice. We got our tea and coffee 20 minutes earlier from our dessert! Once the bill came we paid and wanted to leave. The manager offered us shots for the poor service. We did not accept the "shots"! Horrible service!!!
Came here for my birthday last month..Great food and great staff! We had a table reserved under the tent. The atmosphere was very intimate and relaxing. We had a great time overall.

For a fun evening this is a great place to be.Upon arrival you're politely ushered to the bar area. Strategic placement of course.Once seated the ambiance is perfect with good music in the background.We ordered the 4 Course dinner.1st course freshly baked Pita (3pics) with 3 hearty and healthy bowls of Babaganoush Humus Fava Beans Puree.

I made dinner reservations to celebrate a friend's 50th birthday at Casa La Femme.  I had to change the reservation from a party of 7 to a party of 5 a few hours prior due to weather and the host was very accommodating over the phone. When we arrived, my reservation was not in the system for some odd reason but we were still seated promptly. I reserved a tented sofa area and we were seated at a tented table instead. While we enjoyed our evening, I would have been more comfortable in a sofa area because I had planned on a more lounge-like dining experience with my group.  I also thought the sofa area was prix fixe only and the tables were a la carte or prix fixe. We sat at a tented table and were still required to order from the prix fixe menu. Not a big deal for us but I just found the menu and seating policy a little confusing. The food was great. Yes, the portions are small but the prix fixe menu included three or four courses, which ultimately filled our bellies. I would recommend the grilled octopus and the grilled branzino. Both were well-seasoned and cooked to perfection.  The décor is very exotic and romantic. The belly dancer was a lot of fun. I only wish they would extend her performance or add another dancer to the repertoire. The dancer performs for only 25 minutes during the evening. Our host and servers were very friendly. I asked them to put a candle on our dessert to help us celebrate my friend's birthday and they did.  The host was even kind enough to take a few photos  of our group before we left. I have to mention the bathrooms  because they are large and beautifully tiled.  Loved the woodwork and decore in this restaurant. Just a heads up that Casa La Femme is definitely more of a romantic restaurant than a lounge, which was my first impression after viewing its website.Overall, we had a great time and it was a good choice for group get together. My only recommendations for improvement would be to give guests the option of ordering the prix fixe menu or a la carte and to play some lively music when the belly dancers are not performing to add to the atmosphere.

A fun little haunt in the West Village. I always visit when I go to NYC.Great food. An even better atmosphere. I would go here for the decor alone. Get the two types of hummus. Well worth it.Wasn't sure what to drink last time I was here. (I wasn't feeling cocktails.) The bartender recommended a great rosé that I really enjoyed.

I chose Casa because I wanted an authentic Middle Eastern dining experience with belly dancing for my husband's birthday. It was a tragedy. Mediocre food (at best) through all 4 courses, a prix fixe menu that doesn't include something as basic as rice as a side (wtf?), the belly dancer performed for about 4 minutes, loud loungy techno music that my husband and I had to scream through all night just to be able to hear each other (and why would anyone go to an Egyptian restaurant to be pounded with 90s hip hop remixes all night???). I told the staff upon reservation that it was my husband's birthday dinner so a candle & acknowledgement was supposed to come at dessert. Didn't happen.Basically, I dropped $200 for food/experience worth a tenth of that just because it happened to be in a pretty restaurant with a pretty bathroom in Greenwich Village. I could cry.

I have been to Casa La Femme a few times.  In my experience this is a welcoming place with friendly servers. From the prix fixe menu my favorites are the hummus and baba ganoush, and I also have found that the warak enab, el scolop, and batatas mahamora are excellent. Their drinks are magnificent in and of themselves, especially their mojitos made with fresh mint. I like the ambiance and romance of having dinner in your own private tent. The atmosphere is beautifully exotic, complete with Egyptian style bellydancers who are talented and fun to interact with. I recommend this unique restaurant!!

The food is average at best and the service is bad. Small wine list and not very good choices. The waiter removed appetizers before they were finished. It had a very amateur feeling. The fresh pita bread was very good though. But not worth going just for that.

I threw my boyfriend a surprise Bday here for a group of 12 peopleThe restaurant went above and beyond to ensure the night was special. They decorated the table with rose petals and candles. They gave us a great group menu that included their best dishes and more than enough food for a great price. And of course the belly dancers were an amazing touch to make the night more fun than just dinner. Highly recommend for groups, special occasions or just a some good mediterranean food.

Don't be fooled by the velvet chairs ... this place sucks - the food was terrible (slopped together - cheaply made - my husband's $30 lamb chop should have cost $15 (no - $8 because there was only one chop and they sliced the lamb in a way to make it look like it was a full piece but really it was just as if they put it through a meat slicer to resemble the width of approx 3 slices of corned beef - (saltier than corned beef, by the way. I must reiterate and add that the meat was sliced so thin there's no way they could have prevented it from becoming anything other than well done - he ordered it medium rare - I sent the slop of tomatoes and some sort of cheese back - my husband's salad was drenched in salt - oh and I forgot to mention they poured salt on his lamb as well (that's what I meant by "saltier than corned beef" (my husband's still drinking water - "I'm dying of thirst," he just said - it was a very hot day)  ... what they called pitta isn't pitta - it was hard, crusty, impossible to dip into the tahini and babaganoush (I actually ordered their plate of 3 dips together - she only brought 2 - but when I asked her the difference in price I realized it was more expensive to buy the "special" than to buy these dips individually - I wanted to taste Egyptian food - this was just the same NYC "let me rip you off" routine - and the tahini was watered down almost to the point of being tasteless - the babaganoush was okay (i sure didn't finish it - in fact I barely ate at all (all for the price of $95) - and right - I forgot to mention the service - first there was water all over the table - I asked twice for it to be cleaned up - over appetizers and a drink the waitress asked us if we were ready for our dinner "No, thank you - we came here to rest and talk and then watch  the sunset - ) did she hear us? Of course she did - but a minute later she brought out my husband's excuse of a lamb chop ) "But we told you we didn't want to eat yet" I said. "I'm sorry," said the waitress, "but the chef already made it." That's when I told her to take the tasteless glob of some sort of cheese (minimal amount) and crushed baby tomatoes (cheap kind) ... the waitress came back and said "the chef wants to make this salad again. He'll make it right" - I said "okay" because I hadn't eaten all day and I was hungry and I wanted to be hopeful - the sun would set soon - I wanted to eat - Well, the waitress never came back with this salad she promised me - are you asking yourself if the place was busy? If she was overworked? - guess what? There were only 2 tables - us and some other unfortunate suckers who thought, as I did, that a place close to the river with velvet chairs, claiming to serve Egyptian food ... okay "I'm sorry. I'm sorry" I told my husband. The last time he let me choose a restaurant we went to Souen - I still haven't gotten the stains out of his jeans. Save yourself a fortune - if you want to watch the sunset - bring a bottle of water and a bag of chips or a peanut butter sandwich and watch the sunset in a relaxed state .  I sure wish I did. p.s. I give this one star - hopefully, Yelp will come up with a -17 because that's how I rate this place.p.p.s my husband wants to include fact that waitress poured our $8 "sparkling" water and the beers at the table next to us so quickly (remember that spill I wrote about?) their beer was flat so was our $8 "sparkling" water which lost it's spark ... as did we ...

Great great evening!Place is gorgeous decorated to the highest extent. Staff very nice very accommodating. Luis the manager very personable and evidently a very dedicated hard worker. Belly dancer magnificent and friendly to customers. Music outstanding which set the tone and custom precisely. Food fresh hot and tasty! Drinks delectable! My husband enjoyed it... Something different! Will return with larger group of people!

Eh...came for a friend's birthday, waited 5 years (our party was scheduled for 9 pm, they sat us at 9:30 and gave us our appetizers at 10:30 pm) between each prefix course. The dancer came out for like 2 minute intervals every half hour but, was blocked by creepy old dudes dancing on her each time. *Thinks* "Sir...please sit down sir, no one is paying to see that..(line face)" Main course (lamb) finally came out cold and rubbery at like 11:30 pm and when my phone died in the middle of taking the bday girls' sparkler candle pic, they only had one outlet in the entire restaurant. It was behind the host stand all the way at the entrance and I wasn't allowed to stand back there with my phone nor were they going to be responsible for my phone's life either...so cue me standing like 10 awkward ft away from my phone waiting for it to light up. But the bill came fast as fuck!!!!!!!!! haha!

Amazing!!!! I went to Casa la femme for my birthday. The food and service was exceptional. My husband is vegan and I am not, yet we both left full & happy!! The staff was warm and welcoming as well as attentive to our every need. The flavors of the food was too good! I can't say enough good things about this place!
Do not go to this place! Highly overpriced food and terrible service. Portions are extremely small and the food is terrible. Don't waste your time and money. Go somewhere else and thank me later.

Food is pretty good but service really sucked. We waited over an hour(!) for the main courses. Dishes were not cleared off the table, the hookah never came. The staff never sincerely apologized, their approach was something like "yeah, we're busy today...". Really? Any decent establishment would at least make you feel like they care. They just didn't.

I came here last week with two friends and had an awesome dinner. I got the Tamaya which is the Egyptian falafels in mini pita breads, a phyllo pastry with mushrooms and leeks which were both amazing. The drinks were really good and the dessert was even better. The coconut cake was absolutely incredible and the chocolate dipped baklava was equally as good. I would definitely like to come back on a weekend or later on in the night so that I could see the belly dancers and the party area
Love the ambience, the food the decor! It takes me back to visiting places such as Dubai. Belly dancing- awesome.Only problem, slow service...other than that I loved it

This place really needs to work on their service! complete nightmare . Our waiter was helpful at first but once the drink order and pre fix items were in he was never to be heard of again. The food is good, portions on the smaller side. They gave us a real shitty corner table and wasn't able to see any of the belly dancers. wouldn't recommend coming here for the prefix or on a weekend.

Very disappointed at this restaurant, it used to be much better . I called to make a reservation & asked them if they have belly dancer , they said yes. We went to the Resturent , there was an event there , the belly dancer danced for most of the 30 minutes at the event  the music was keep going on & off ,it was not good
Pretty good food, horrific service, and shady business practices sneaking stuff into the table and then the bill. Wouldn't go again.
Amazing place to go for celebrations, a date as you can ask for booth table, food and service were great, and stay for the belly dancers show, will definitely keep you entertained...

I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Went there once before for a friend's birthday and then decided to bring some friends there for what was probably one of my favorite girls nights ever!!!! The food was delicious, staff was SUPER friendly, the ambiance was sexy, there was a little show for some unique entertainment, good vibes, and tons of fun! I can't wait to go back again!!!!!!

Oh dear. What a failure.I will make this brief as the food is totally unmemorable We arrived on a sat night at 9pm and couldnt help notice 2 things. Firstly how nice the place is but secondly how empty. Obviously the latter is a bad sign for somewhre on a sat night in the west village.We decided to opt for the a la carte menu as other reviews had mentioned the prix fix wasn't worth it.The waiter offered us some mixed appetizers.  Big mistake.  Each one came with one piece of pitta despite us being a table of 5Its now 10 pm and we enquired about the belly dancer. She is late was the repsonse. Brilliant so lots of dips and nothing to dip with and one absent belly dancer. Now the entrees. The server suggested lamb chops as being the most popular dish and their speciality.Ok 29 bucks ain't bad but  none of the entrees come with a side , not even a slight garnish so we order a stack of sides. The lamb chops come arrive and what were supposed to be medium rare are extremely well done and charred. When they do cone back out  with med rare ones 15 mins later all the sides have already been eaten or gone cold. But the manager assures me of some rice.  Of course this never came.Finally a belly dancer appears for 2 mins and then sadly she dissapears again. The bill arrives and we nearly fall off our seats as its ridiculously expensive for really average food .I will give this place stars for decor and bathrooms only.Live and learn .

What a great spot! Definitely will be returning. Had a friends birthday party there, about a party of 10 girls. Just so happened to be there while an entire cast of Great Gastby was there (it was a themed birthday party) and so it was just really an experience. The manager there makes it work! I mean she is simply amazing, no idea how she does it. And her two main servers were just excellent. Everything went so smoothly even with like 3 parties going on. Everything we asked for in the beginning she found a way to make work. Who doesn't love not being told 'no'. I will be referring this place to everyone having a party/event. Great staff, beautiful decor and awesome vibes. My only complaint is the wine selection. They didn't have any dessert wines, so nothing sweet. I love my Moscato's.Also:Forgot to mention, the food was great, the salmon was so fresh! The music was perfection, they had hits that had the entire place jamming, and we had hookah which was fine, but I think it only came in one flavor which was appropriate so the smells didn't clash.

Best Mediterranean place I have been to yet! The pita is amazing the hummus is amazing  and most important the service is amazing everyone here treats you so good. Also they have hookah and ambiance is perfect can't wait to come back!!! Also the floor in here is real grass!!!! In love

I have very mixed feeling about my experience at Casa La Femme. TLDR: Good food, fun vibe but terrible service.Positives: Food is very tasty. Five of us started with hummus, babaganoush and zabadi yogurt which were all great - served with large warm pieces of pita. Then we split moussaka and a vegetable tagine - both flavorful. The side of mushrooms was my favorite dish - tender, juicy and absolutely delicious.The space is huge and very cool. The front bar area is funky with grass on the floor, open air almost like a terrace setting. The back of the restaurant has lots of seating with "tents" lined along the wall. Loud music pumping, very crowded and has a party vibe.Negative: We received really really bad service from an extremely snobby waitress. We went here for a bachelorette dinner with reservations for a regular table but they seated us in a tent where it's a mandatory 4 course pre fixe. We weren't that hungry so when we asked if we could just order from the regular menu, the waitress gave us a really hard time about. "Tents are pre fixe only, everyone has to order from this menu, I don't think we can sit you at a regular table here, maybe just in the front bar area blah blah" We had reservations so only after we spoke to the hostess did the waitress magically have a regular table ready for us. (It was only 6pm super early for NYC dining so the place was pretty much empty)Like I said, we weren't very hungry so we decided to split a bunch of dishes and that was when the service took a serious turn. Our waitress literally rolled her eyes at us when we ordered making snide comments such as "That's it? Well, if you think so. That won't be enough but whatever..."And then when we didn't order any drinks, she said "you're not drinking?! Come on really? Aren't you out for a party??" and rolling her eyes again.WOW. Just wow. Who was she to criticize us for splitting dishes and not wanting to drink at that time? Not that it's any of her business and we didn't need to justify our order but we already have been pre-gaming with drinks and snacks before. We wanted to take a break before partying the rest of the night.She was mad because we weren't spending enough so she could get a bigger tip. It was ridiculous as she was extremely friendly with other large tables - even holding another customer's baby. She never came to check on us, even when we were missing a dish, never refilled our water. It was as if our table didn't exist. It made for an extremely disappointing dinner. Servers should treat all table with the same courtesy no matter how much or little they spend.On our way out, we stopped to talk to the manager who was very apologetic. He took my friend's phone number to speak to her privately another time, said sorry a bunch of times and hooked us up with a free bottle of champagne and hookah. I'm glad the manager was responsive to us but am not sure if he went to speak to the waitress right away or at all (it was very busy by that point) Therein lies the mixed feelings, I enjoyed the food and it is just one waitress and the manager was responsive but I can't get over how rude she was. And in a city with so many restaurants, it doesn't make me want to head back there.

If it wasn't for the food still being really good after all these years then I'm not sure if I'd even give a 3-star rating.  My boyfriend and I visited last night to celebrate my birthday. I was so excited to take him. Being of Egyptian decent, I loved that I had a special Egyptian restaurant I could enjoy. Not much around except Steinway in Astoria. And they have nothing there to compare to this caliber of dining. I've been a patron since before they moved from their location by the 59th street bridge. What I loved then was the ambiance. I felt as if I was in a palace in the Middle East. It felt much more authentic years ago. The decor may still be the same but a lot has changed. Now it feels very gimmicky. The waitstaff was nice but there seemed to be a lot of miscommunication. First, we weren't given a water choice of tap water. Off the bat charged $8 for their fancy water. Our waiter was very attentive however. But perhaps too much. Every 5 minutes he checked on us. Tried to take dishes from us when we were still picking. We felt soooo rushed which is very disappointing considering this is not a cheap meal. We did the prifixe menu (4 courses) and were rushed through every course. We maybe had 10 min to try to enjoy each course. And while being rushed through our meals we listened to mainstream music like Justin Timberlake and Rihanna. Not exactly fits in with the beautiful tents and Egyptian decor. The only time Arabic music came on was when the belly dancer performed. Do I even mention they sat us behind a huge pillar so we couldn't fully enjoy the show?  I've recommended this place to many throughout the years. Sad to see this restaurant lose itself. I won't be coming back anytime soon. Save your money.
This place was awesome . Great food. The lamb chops are out of this world and so was the service. Thumbs up to the waiters

Terrible. Food wasn't great--service was horribly slow and there was water squirting down my back bc of air conditioning issues. It was insane and the most horrible experience I've had in a while. I am part of the service industry and normally I don't give people a crazy hard time bc I get it--but I had to ask the manager and wait staff and bartenders about items I ordered multiple times. Don't bother--there's so many other better options in the west village and for the price you are def not getting anything you pay for.

Came here to celebrate a wonderful bday for a special person. Combine tasty dishes, a dash of savory drinks, and a pinch of a beautiful belly dancing show - what more could we have wanted?!The decor was very...mediterranean/middle eastern. Beautiful colored glass, lamps and chandeliers hanging, and patterns reminiscent of Istanbul. The slightly dim ambience would make it great for personal getherings, or a date experience. You have the option of staying int the front/bar area, with access to views of the sidewalk, or settle in on one of the dining tents in the back. The staff was accomodating and attentive. It's rare that I find myself not having to ask for our tables glasses to be refilled; Service was definitely at another level. The glasses of wine and mimosas were a welcome thirst quencher. With the level of attention and detail, the staff never missed a beat.The food was exquisite and delicious. From the hummus and baba ghanouj appetizers, to the salmon and lamb main courses, and the desserts - filled to the brim with food and laughter, the experience was more than I had expected. This is defintiely, now, one of my favourite restaurants in the city.

Great atmosphere, delicious food and exceptional service!My friends and I came here for drinks, food and hookah on a Saturday night and we got a table instantly and were treated like kings.  The seats are comfortable and plush and all of the decor and details - from the beautiful velvet canopies to the perfectly placed roses and candles was perfect.  Definitely would recommend!Make sure to get a side of Batatas Mahamora (the Egyptian-style French fries)!  These are to die for.

One of the best Hookah places I've been to, despite the extremely aggressive yet awkward service. It must have been the guy's first day there or something because he was accosting us with his uncomfortable service, for real. Actually, come to think of it, so was the bartender. But the ambiance here is really nice. It's in a really nice neighborhood and only a 1 minute walk from all the Meatpacking madness and the beautiful Hudson River Park. Drinks and food were standard price, maybe cheaper. I would definitely come back. Our belly dancer was insanely hot--middle eastern Ariana Grande.

This has been one of my worst experiences ever. I read many of the bad reviews regarding the terrible service they have and trust me, they were so accurate. This place is extremely bad in some many ways:1) extremely slow and bad service2) we were sited on a corner table next to the stairs that take you to the restroom. According to the hostess, the belly dancers were supposed to come to our area (never happened)3) bad service again4) music (aside from the one played during the show) is worst than the one played in an elevator from the 80's. Seriously, consider using Pandora or Spotify but your music can really make you feel so depressed.5) after we finished our dinner, we must have waited like 45 min to get "desserts" and coffee (Turkish coffee that supposedly takes 15 minutes to brew due to the highest quality) that was never brought to the table but included on the check.6) desserts that my 5 year old daughter could bake way better, let's just say that a cornbread mini muffin with orange sorbet on top is not exactly something appealing.7) did I mention terrible slow service????8) after desserts, another waiting time of 45-50 minutes to get the check9) check was incorrect, so let's add another 30 minutes to finally get it......still incorrect!!!! Are u fucking kidding me???? On top of that, the waiter just limited to apologize and mentioned that he was trying his best but they were short on staff. My bad for choosing a place that is not capable of offering good service to everybody that decides to spend money on their business.10) forgot to mention that the show that we couldn't see, lasted maybe 30 minutes. We spent 4 hrs and there was only 1 show with one woman. I was expecting something else to be honest.11) we decided to asked for our coats as the waiter didn't come back to our table with the correct check. Basically he found us at the main entrance with another incorrect check.12) manager came but didn't really offer any solution and we decided just to pay and leave.We went to this place because some friends got a Groupon. My best piece of advise, DON'T waste your money, time and energy on this place. It's NOT worth it.Manhattan has some many awesome places to go and this is not certainly one of them.Terrible service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Went Saturday night had reservations for the "tent" tables and little did we know the tents are subject to a pre-fix menu for $60.Reservation was for 10pm and we didn't get seated until 10.30 pm meanwhile  the belly dance had already started so we had to wait in the bar area drinks were good but at $15 a pop they are completely overpriced...Food was much better then I expected some people said the food is mediocre both our food and service was excellent, waitress was very attentive checked in multiple times to ensure everything is okay.Nobody mentioned it but the music in the background is amazing it's a mix of lounge, chillout and middle eastern music very upbeat and trendy.It's a decent place to chill out and have fun yet totally inconsistent with the whole experience you feel as the second time around I tried it food was cold and tasteless and they had closed the main section which we found out only later that  belly dancers are on Saturday only. It was such a bummer and we spent $250 on bland food.  Not the same ambiance without the music and dance. Try it on Saturday otherwise go somewhere else. P.s : We asked for extra pita bread and we were told it is $3.50 extra for every pita bread ( three palm size pieces) plate.

Food was really good. Service suckedMultiple servers kept coming back to ask us "what was your drink again" an hour after we had ordered from them. The liquor tab alone was $800 and everyone was sober because of how slow the drinks were coming. Such a waste of money.

This restaurant just doesn't know how to do business. They made us feel uncomfortable the whole night with sales pitches. We frequent the best restaurants, so we're used to menus with prix fix, expensive wine lists, etc. But this restaurant takes it to another level. The service was poor in other respects - like as if everyone was first day on the job. They gave us the wrong check. They told opentable we were a no-show, probably to avoid paying them the fee. The food tasted good, but had the presentation of an Applebee's. Zero garnishes or attention to detail. My fiancé got lamb, they gave her a butter knife, and had no sharp knife to offer when we asked. Mind blowing how they are still in business given the location is not great and the restaurant is terrible

Wonderful place!!!Please come here and enjoy yourself. Bring your family, wife, girl/boyfriend or come alone.You will enjoy yourself either way and desire to come back time and again. Every time I visit NYC I must stop by at least once, if not multiple times. Everything is so positive, and the management/ownership is so nice!If you have one restaurant that you absolutely must visit while in NYC, please let it be this one.One of the best restaurants in Manhattan, and this place has lots of them!

The food and drinks were reasonable if a little overpriced. However, the bill included two bottles of wine when we only ordered one. We asked the waiter to have this removed from the bill and waited over half an hour for the adjustment to be made. Later we discovered that our cards had been charged for both the incorrect bill and the corrected bill. Would not return.

I went there with my fiance for Valentine's Day. When we first walked in...the decor & atmosphere was breathtaking. The staff was friendly & the food was amazing. We had the lamb...it was soooo good. It was cooked to perfection. The only issue I have was the price. I thought it was $150 for the tented table & & 100 for the non tented. The price was per person. They did not make it clear to us when we made the reservation. That is not their usual pricing though. It was a valentines day special price.

After visiting and completely falling in love with Egypt earlier this year, I immediately googled Egyptian restaurants in NYC and was so excited when I came across Casa La Femme. Since my birthday was just a couple months later and it seemed like a place to celebrate a special event, I decided to have my family birthday dinner at CLF. My party of 4 came here on a Friday evening and the place was completely empty when we arrived. We were not asked what type of table we preferred but we were seated at a lovely tented table which we were happy with, until we later found out (after we had already eaten and thought that the prix fixe was the only option they had) that the tented tables are prix fixe only and you can order a la carte at regular tables. While you get a lot for what you are paying, my party and I would have greatly preferred the a la carte menu as I wanted to get a bunch of appetizers rather than one appetizer and a main course (I am a vegetarian and did not like any of the options they had for the main course). I was finally able to eat the falafel I had come here for and while delicious, I was so disappointed that only two falafel balls came with the appetizer. The restaurant did not start filling up until after 8 pm, when we were nearly finished, and we found out that the belly dancing would not start until 9:15 pm. I was SO disappointed by this as one of the major reasons I chose this as my birthday spot was because the ambiance looked amazing, however we never got to experience it. I would like to come back later at night just to get a feel of what it's like when the restaurant is actually busy and to hopefully order from the a la carte menu to get more falafel, but my first experience here was a bust.

I have no idea why this place gets any decent reviews at all. Have New Yorkers forgotten what food is supposed to taste like?This place is awful. I came here for a birthday party for an 8.30 reservation but they sat us early (which turned out to be bad because the belly dancer doesn't actually start until 10pm). The service was slow and the dancer came over for a total of 30 seconds to collect a dollar at the end of the dinner. The entertainment was not worth it.The food was one of the worst meals I've had in a long time. First, let me start with the fact that they MAKE you get a pre-fix menu for parties of (6?) and more. The bill came to over 100 dollars a person for HORRIBLE food. Second, do NOT get items that are marked up extra on the menu. For example, why did I pay 5 dollars extra for a chewy rubbery borderline inedible octopus? Why did I pay extra for dry/fatty lamb chops? Some in our party got "well-done" salmon which came out medium with a gallon of salt pored all over it. I don't even want to mention dessert because it was gross.This was a god awful experience. What made the matters worse is this meal made me violently ill. PLEASE skip this and go somewhere with good food.

Loved the venue, food, and hookah. The scallops were giant and amazing, the hummus and pita were great, grape leaves were also tasty. Hookah was expensive but a nice end to the meal. The lemonata cocktail was amazing!Minus one star because the waitress kept trying to upsell us--hard--to the point of annoyance.

Had a memorable night here with some of closest friends. Upon walking up to the entrance, right away you get the sense you are walking into a elegant place. The front bar was very inviting while a bunch of us waited for the rest of the group to show up.No complaints at all on the drinks, food, or service. Being middle-eastern and having been to many similarly themed restaurants all over NJ and NYC, I can say the belly dancers and the overall experience here does not disappoint with a great vibe all around. We even got comped tequila shots from the owner toward the end of the night which was pretty unexpected!

It was the perfect night for a group of 7 girls...We had an amazing waitress that I should say, me as a business owner should be promoted to manager, as she knows her clientele and knows how to deliver. Her name is Imene, ask for her and I hope you get her.Food was great, many options make your palate crave everything and all I tasted was delicious, had the calamari salad and some kofte( lamb) as appetizers, delicious, my entree was the lamb chops and they were 4 in my plate 3 extremely tender and well cooked, one chewy, not everything is perfection, drinks are reasonable and tasty, mangotini was the drink of the night...Now the dancer, she is a professional belly dancer extremely talented... Go for the show....I would recommend this place to all my friends... thanks for the great night.

My bf and I decided to venture out to this place because he bought a Groupon (4 course dinner for 2 for about $85). The service was phenomenal, like really. They were always going around making sure you glasses were always full, new utensils were given for every course, and best of all just very courteous. It made the stay very enjoyable. As for the food, it was not mind blowing but def above average. I would have liked it better if the portions were bigger. It was a bit too small for what we were paying for and we were eating at a discount. The belly dancer was young, blonde, and beautiful. I loved the fact that she interacted with every one of us. We actually tipped her because she was so great. Now, the big let down was when the bill came. We were a bit upset we were still hungry and having to end up paying for mediocre cocktails. I had 2 and I wasn't even tipsy. It's as if I was drinking juice. It tasted good but you need to put more alcohol if you are going to charge $16 a pop. Overall, the experience is great but I don't think I will be returning again because the food and the drinks are just not worth the cost.

Be careful with decor especially over the top decor like in this place. I'm a clean freak and the upholstered chairs were disgusting. Looked like dried snot. Service was aweful. We had this ostentatious queenie bartender who had such an annoying attitude we were turned off. That's the tough thing about being in this neighborhood.Food was just ok but never came out with enough pita but  the branzino came out pretty good. A dying tribute to the middle east in the village, i would never step back into this place again. 1 star for the branzino.

Great for vegans. Did the prix fixe and had veg options in each course. We took foreeeever to order because we kept talking and they weren't pushy or aggravated (and I wouldn't blame them if they had been). However, each new busser/server kept saying hello to my date and saying that they recognized him from a previous week. He kept denying that he was there within the last two years and said it must have been someone else hmmm...either way: DO NOT BRING A MISTRESS HERE AND YOUR WIFE TOO BC THEY WILL REMEMBER. Lol. One server said welcome back to me and I'd never been there before so either my date had a type or they were completely bullshitting. If you're a cheater just dont take that chance. Servers and bussers were so sweet. Bartender was phenomenal. Martinis were great although the makers mark manhattans could have been stronger. Hated their signature cocktails but if you like slightly fruitier drinks you'll like them. Just not my taste. Belly dancer was whack. We thought it would be authentic but she was some hoochie looking chick from Jersey who basically stayed in one section the whole night and didn't reeally make her way through the restaurant. Food was 3.5 out of 5. Babaghanoush was ok but the fava(?) bean mash and hummus apps on prix fixe were great. Wish they had vegan desserts but they didn't and by then I was to stuffed and buzzed to care. Ps- came here on a Thurs evening at 6:30...left at 12am. Don't judge us.

I had an amazing time celebrating my birthday at casa la femme. The Decour is beautiful, The food was so good I definitely recommend as an appetizer the grilled octopus and Lamb chop for the entrée I promise you won't regret it. And to top off the evening we had a beautiful belly dancer, drinks and everybody wish me a "happy birthday"

I really wanted to like this place. I really did. Treated poorly. No communication. Not even 3 stars by me. Many months ago I was e-introduced to the events manager at CLF by the head of Autism Speaks as a great place to host a fundraiser event. We never met up - mostly due to my schedule. Upon making reservations here for a Saturday night dinner, I reached out to the woman who had been so eager to meet. Two weeks later- no response.  Ding.We had 7 girls for dinner pre-bachelorette party. Several have strict dietary concerns. Thus,  3 times it was confirmed we were doing a la carte - not prix fixe. We were seated at a fancy corner table with the hoop and tent hanging above us. Told this was a "special" table. Then told by a waitress and later a manager we must do prix fixe. Um no - we must NOT do anything we confirmed multiple times. We were treated with attitude and confusion. Also, the hoop and gauze thing didn't work for us. It took 15 minutes and a lot of laughter to have the servers help clip it up so we could see each other.We went to order a bottle of champagne for the occasion. On the list was a $30 bottle and next price point was $115.
