Considering the fact we were already planning to order $15 cocktails (yes - $15 for no great shakes), we said we'd try the $30 bottle (and could get a few at that price). "We don't have that in stock." Wait, seriously? You already argued with us about the menu and table and then you have the gall to have such varying price points and not have the only one under $100? This really annoyed me.Dislikes: Lack of communication. Being treated like a 2nd class citizen (even though I am a customer). Grass carpet (stupid for stilettos as they get stuck and can see people tripping). Champagne list and price points. Fish of the day with bones all over.Like: Octopus. Scallops. Dessert. Lamb is good but not great.The portions are really small. If you are with people that eat (read: no models), do the prix fixe. It's probably worth it.

Great ambiance and decor! food is spectacular too. Great for dinner with friends since the music is loud and fun. Belly dancer can also be fun depending on your group. Private cabana tables are not always worth it cause the one I had made us feel secluded from the fun, but other than that it was great! Food is also great - but portions are small so order accordingly. Overall, You won't be disappointed!One star off for our secluded seating and the music being a little too loud for a family dinner.

My husband and I celebrated our 9 years wedding anniversary.  The place was wonderful!  I loved the romantic ambiance. We sat under a private tent.  Definitely try the mango mintini and the hischibus shot.  Great food!  I had the trio hummus, crab cake & salmon.  The bellydancer was awesome!  She actually came by at our table and I got to belly dance as well!!! The staff was fantastic!

Wonderful environment and great food. I had the crab kofta as an app and the prawns as my entree. The service is friendly, attentive and helpful. I highly recommend this place - good for a friends night out, good for a date.
This place just sucks !!!! I've Been waiting for 1 hour  to get my table, no belly dancers , the food is horrible , the table was broken !!!! It just sucks

Casa is a really fun place whether you go for the great drinks and music in the lounge or for a sit down meal for the great middle eastern menu.  The food is very authentic and they don't try to make the dishes overly complicated or fancy.  Definitely comfort food.  Most nights there is a belly dancer in the evening which is actually a blast and not at all silly as you might think.  My other favorite thing to do is to enjoy a hookah after dinner with friends.  I highly recommend Casa La Femme.

This is seriously an amazing restaurant! They have authentic Egyptian and Greek cuisine. The ambiance is amazing and the staff are beyond superb! I can see why celebrities like Jay-Z, Alicia Keys and Jimmy Fallon come here! If you are in the city and you want an amazing experience and great food... Come here!

Prix fixe: "a meal consisting of several courses served at a total fixed price". Well, they call it that here, but although you get great appetizers and a nice little dessert for $60, you have to (depending what you order) pay an extra $7 for rice and $7 for vegetables or you may just end up with a lonely fish on your plate. Only in New York would you be treated this way. The waiter made lots of recommendations but it was pretty obvious he was just trying to up-sell.They've invested a lot in decor, the dancer was great (just comes out once so don't miss it), and the food and service was pretty good. The ambience is excellent until the dancing ends and they turn the place into a generic techno lounge. I'd happily do without the luxurious individual bathrooms with chairs if I could get a few grains of rice with my dinner.

Is it just me or is Casa La Femme a majestic, Egyptian haven. When I go to this restaurant, I find that I am enchanted by the charming ambiance, alluring tunes, and winsome waiting staff. It is a top of the line restaurant in NYC that still makes me giddy in reminiscence. I was absolutely enthralled by the elegance, vibrancy, cocktails and cuisine at this restaurant.The first time I went, upon arrival, after maneuvering past an oval bar, I entered my oasis - the main dining area. Table seating is in the middle; however, I had preferred to crawl into the private peripheral seating areas and declare one enclave as my territory, guarded by the protective drapes. Prior to that evening, aware of this seating option, I had contemplated doing one of two things - blanketing myself in the love of a significant other for a night of indulgence OR acting as a queen on my throne, served to my desire. That night I went with my brother and father, so it's safe to say I engaged in the latter activity with ease. Not because I'm self-righteous and haughty but because the service had me feeling like royalty.On that particular evening I had a few dishes from the a la carte menu. We all started off with a cocktail and then we were served mazzas with pita bread to our liking. I order the grilled octopus as an appetizer, the Grilled Bay Scallops as an entree and had a taste of my father's branzino. We topped the meal off with the baklava for dessert.  I'll admit, the food didn't have to be mind blowing because the fully immersive experience of entertainment, cocktails, quality service and fine cuisine filled me with joy. Although Casa La Femme is pricey, it's worth every penny! Try to go when the belly dancers are performing, which I assume is either every evening or only weekend evenings. Also, the draped area seating must be reserved beforehand on a busy weekend so I'd recommend calling much earlier than your planned dinner date.For more of my personal restaurant reviews, check out my blog! thechiclush.com

Appalled! If you care about your business, fire yourself or whoever is running Casa.The food is amazing, the decor is neither  appealing or functional. The waiters are a mess, expect to have to pick up your own menu and wait a hour for anything.If you are lucky and the stars align the food will be amazing and the service spectacular. Don't count on it!

I absolutely loved the service here! The wait staff was great. I felt that everyone wanted to accommodate our needs! The food was absolutely delicious and the belly dancing was fun to watch! We will be returning!

The atmosphere of this place is pretty cool! And that's the end of my positive comments about it. When my boyfriend and I arrived we were asked to wait for a table- totally understandable. But after 15-20 mins of waiting, the hostess came to get us and said we would be sat very soon that they were just waiting on the table to be cleaned and they needed to seat the bar table we were at. She clearly lied to us. We waited another 15-20 minutes for her to find an open table and were finally seated 30-40 mins after being there. Upon reaching our table, we realized we were being seated and asked to eat at, essentially, an end table that we would have had to bend in half to eat off of. Thankfully, they switched the table for us. 10 mins later we had water and a glass of wine. 20 mins later we had our first course45 mins later we still hadn't even seen our APPETIZER. I'm generally a very patient person in restaurants. I served for many years. But this was unacceptable. A NYC restaurant should be ready for high volume in their dining room and at this point they weren't even that busy. A complete disappointment in terms of service. We never saw our appetizers so after waiting 30+ minutes, we got up and left. Worst service ever and for the prices they were asking I expect 10x better service. I would suggest trying to Cowgirl. That's where we are now. Much better!!!

Came here for a birthday celebration. Birthday girl picked it. Most likely for her husband since the men enjoyed it more than we did lol.Reservation was for 10. We were given a table for 7 with a separate table for the other 3. Ummm. Hmmmm. I guess since we arrived later, we sat at the separate table like we did not belong to the same party. Needless to say that put a little damper on our night. Birthday girl wasn't happy about that. We ordered 3 bottles of wine, some cocktails, appetizers and entree. Grilled octopus was ok. When it arrived it was covered in arugula. You literally have to dig through it to get to the octopus. It was ok. The hummus, babaganoush and another trio served with pita was great. I recommend getting that. My grilled scallops was ok, it also came covered with arugula. Not a great presentation. Bf got the grilled whole fish with a side of their rice. The Branzino was perfect . Moist and seasoned well. Service is horrible. Given we're  a pretty big party. I would think as a waitress she had devised a system on handling big orders like ours. I guess not. She had her paper and wrote down our orders. Repeated it. And then came back to verify our order according to our seating. When the appetizers came, our orders were set at the other end of the other table. It was all over the place. We asked for another bowl of pita. Again they bring it to the other end of the other table. And after repeating our entree orders quite a few times, she comes to my bf to say she thought he wanted the salmon instead of the Branzino. Only redeeming factor about that booboo was that he was happy about the fish. Other than that, she's a ditz! #sorrynotsorry. To make matters worse, we paid with 5 credit cards and cash. Not our fault that she took the cash and did not swipe all 5 cards we gave her. She came back to our group, complaining about her tip. With her service everyone thought 15% is enough for her crappy service. She couldn't explain herself well and we were under the impression that our bill was paid in full and we gave her a decent amount of tip. She left our table slamming the pitcher of water she was holding down the table. The manager came and sorted it all out for us. And she never came back.For over $100 per person, that night wasn't worth it. I will never ever pick this place for anything in a million years. 2 stars for the whole fish. Minus a million for service.PS. If you did not heed my warning and still came to this place and you get the waitress who cannot describe their food other than "it's to die for", ask for someone else.

Absolutely stunning restaurant! I took my boyfriend here foe his 27th birthday (middle of Nov) and everything was perfect! We had the prex fixe menu and it was really delicious. I definitely recommend the lamb chops, prawns, crab kofta and the beef sausage to try. We also had a bottle of Rioja but its not on the wine list, I forgot the name but you can ask the waiter to tell you. Its pricey but worth it. The belly dancer was the best I ever seen, she was amazing. Overall 5 stars to excellent service, decor, food and entertainment. Thank you to the manager for taking care of us both, this is now a definite place for us to come back too!

The food here is really tasty. A bit pricey though, especially for two tiny crab cakes costing $15. But  on the other hand, I was not disappointed in the quality of the food. And the ambiance was spectacular. And the belly dancer was quite entertaining too!The first time I went here, the service was impeccable. They knew it was my first time and really catered to me and my girlfriend. The second time I went here, the service left a lot to be desired. It was more crowded this time and the service was slow. In addition, both my girlfriend and I had a complaint involving our drinks. It was too strong and not to our liking. It tasted like medicine. It appeared that it took alot of effort to get it changed and it seemed like they were annoyed. When the drinks came back, it didn't seem like they changed it at all. Just added more ice! Then when our waiter came to ask us if everything was fine, we just said we were ok. He seemed concerned at first and asked us to tell him what's wrong. When we explained to him about the drinks, he quickly seemed like he didn't care and walked away stating that there is nothing he can do about that. Then why did you keep prodding us to find out what was wrong then??!!As I stated, the food is very good. But make sure you do not have a problem with your food or drink because you will be treated like you are annoying them and will have to make them work more to satisfy you. I did give them 4 stars simply for the food and the incredible look of the place, however, it missed the mark of getting 5 stars because of the service.

Wanted to try something new so I drove from the Dirty Jersey, to the NYC to try a Egyptian restaurant I saw on Groupon, so skeptical I was. Parking in front, gorgeous place, nose still turned up, got some hummus app asking myself what did I get myself into, OOOOMMMYYYY SOMEONE GRAB THE WHEEL! Amazing at its best! Prix fix menu $60, Drink $14, Waiter Tip $20, Customer service PRICELESS!!! My palates are thanking me! Amir Thank You!
The food is good and the environment is fun. The baklava is out of this world. The belly dancer was great too. A little pricey - but its NYC so thats the norm when you order drinks.

Zero stars for the service.  Servers disappeared for an extended period of time.  Everyone's food didn't arrive at the same time.  Chaotic and disorganized.It's a shame because the food was actually really good.  I give the food 4 stars.  Although the Branzino was cold by the time it arrived, it was still tasty and the starter dips were great.  I would go back for the ambiance - just drinks, music and the belly dancer.  It's too much hassle to order food.

Delicious food - Check; Outstanding Services - Check; Ambiance - CHECK!; Belly Dancer - Check; Prompt Service - CheckImmediately upon arrival I recognized the venue that hosted NYE festivities a few years ago... not sure why I didn't place it when reserving but whatever.  There were parties of all sizes and the place boasts energy.  We were only 2 in our party and did the pre-fixe menu (do the octopus starter) and even though our evening plans were on a tight schedule to no fault of their own, they accommodated us and our schedule.The belly dancer was awesome and added to the experience for the diverse guests (including multiple bachelorette parties).  Other than the inebriated dude behind me that had no sense of etiquette or space (not the venue's fault), it was a perfect dinner spot.

Went here for my husbands birthday had a blast . Waiters were great. Food was excellent but small portion. 3 stars because we had to wait at least  45 mins despite having a reservation which cause us to go overtime on our limo

We waited an hour and a half to be seated, although we had a reservationWe were only given one fixed-price menu for $60, and were only given the normal a la carte menu when we specifically asked for itThe bar did not have a cocktail menu, a drinks menu or even a PRICE LIST! Which we specifically asked for and were told that they don't have it by the bartender The food was ok, but the portions were insultingly small - 6 pita breads for 6 people, so we asked for some more when we finished - they gave us 3 more!My wife ordered the shrimp entree, she got 3 shrimps and a spoonful of rice.Desert (also included in the fixed-price menu) is a "surprise" so you just eat what they give youTerrible to the point we were advising people at the door to leave

Chillin @ AltSmoke  on McDougal Street in the West Village- NYC ...I referred 3 woman from Jordan to your lounge. Around 930pm on 9/16/14.They were looking for a place to relax, have cocktails, good middle eastern food, and enjoy a Shisha! (hookah) Hope they Enjoy! From: Stephanie

5 stars for the ambience.... The most romantic place I have even seen in NY. You could easily cuddle up and enjoy a fantastic meal.You have to go there to believe it.Though I was here to celebrate a friends promotion. We had champagne and hookah... The belly dancers were good. I would love to go back with my bf for a cosy dinner but I Dint see much vegetarian on the menu which is what is holding me back!
Great place for special occasions, parties or just to gather w friends. Have thrown incredible fundraisers, birthday parties and company events there. A true home away from home.

Really cool venue - nice big bar area and large amount of seating in the back.  Enjoyed trying a few items on their drink list - and super friendly bartenders who new exactly what to recommend.  They have great dishes that are perfect for sharing as well.  I didn't realize they have hookah there too - will try that on my next visit!And ladies with stilettos watch out - the bar area has a grass floor!  Gotta check it out though ....

Awesome place.  The food is fantastic.  The staff is even better.  The manager Louis makes you feel like you're the only customer in the place. The customer service is unparalleled. I will continue to come here. The decor is sexy, warm, and romantic.  Great place for a date or just an evening out with friends.  The entertainment is icing on the cake. Love this place.

Great ambiance and atmosphere. I took my girlfriend here and we had a great time. I made a reservation for a tented table that was very romantic. The belly dancing was fun and was paired with great music. The food was pretty good. The staff was very friendly and attentive, I don't think my water glass was ever below brimming.

Went there on a friday night. I expected it to be noisy and crowded since it is in the city but to my surprise, it was pretty empty. The inside of this restaurant had a dark classy/fancy environment. There were chandeliers hanging from the ceiling and the floor had indoor grass. I didnt like that much because i was wearing heels and the glass felt wet. The bathrooms were very classy as well with chandeliers. The overall decor of the place is very nice, maybe a little more light would make it a bit nicer. When it comes to the food, i ordered there chicken shish kebab and a side of sautéed veggies. The order took forever to come, but  i enjoyed my glass of wine and the belly dance show during my wait. The dancer was very talented and even did sone crazy dance moves with a bunch of candles. She literally had a big plate with lit candles and was dancing with it on her belly, her legs, her head omg crazyFinally the food came and that chicken kebab was soooo good! It was two pieces of chicken it was so tasty so tender, superb! Then the side of sautéed veggies complemented the chicken and it really made up for the long wait to get served. Oh i must also add the hookah was horrible!!! And they only have one flavor. ( double apple)

Let me start this one by saying that the atmosphere was very relaxing and cool. It was a great experience. Not to loud but very fun and entertaining. Great food and drinks. Will definitely go back. A bit expensive, bit all worth in. See the pictures I posted.

The food was okay, and the wait staff could've been better trained. This place was very happening on a Friday night and they had great live entertainment. Our waitress and wait staff was a little odd though. Our waitress wouldn't let us see the dessert menu, and would only "orally recite" it to us (her words). She also brought soft drinks out and just put them on our table (very generous, but nobody ordered those).

I LOVE Casa La Femme!  It is the place to be on Friday and Saturday nights when you want to go to a spot in the city that is vibrant and full of people having a good time.  The rest of the week is great for a date night and if you want a restaurant that is more low-key. Brunch Time:The Egyptian Oatmeal is fresh, delicious, and unexpectedly good!  I would have that for a morning meal every single day.Dinner Time:The pita and hummus is to die for!  The lamb is well cooked and tasty.  The chicken is delicious and tender!  They also have these Egyptian sausages called Beef Kofta, although it can leave your breathe a little oniony, it is really delicious.The portions may be small as some people say, but if you do the Pre-Fixed menu you get four courses that may not seem like it will fill you up at first but it definitely will.  Plus, you get to sit in a tented table and truly experience the restaurant.Decor:The restaurant is absolutely beautiful and you feel like an Egyptian Goddess walking into the restaurant.   Belly Dancing! Need I say more? The women they use for the show are seductive & beautiful.  Customer Service:I have went to Casa La Femme multiple times for parties and dates.  Sarina is the event coordinator at Casa La Femme and I have booked multiple parties with her.  She is the best event coordinator I have worked with. She is amazing at her job, truly attentive, and if you want she will even enjoy the party with you and make sure everything goes smoothly.  She is upbeat and knows how to get the job done!  She has been working for the company for an extremely long time and knows the ins and outs of Casa La Femme.  She is very detail oriented and makes sure everything is perfect.  If you ever need or want to book an event...Sarina is your woman!I have also had the pleasure of working with Luis who is the manager at Casa La Femme.  He is extremely professional and addressed any concern I had.  He made sure every event and date I had at Casa La Femme went smoothly.  He always made sure there were beautiful flowers and alcoholic beverages flowing at every table!   He is very detail oriented.  He is very upbeat and wants to make sure each customer has an amazing time at the restaurant. He is always a pleasure to work with at any of the events. The best server is Mario!  He is attentive and knows the menu well.  He looks out for his customers and makes sure we receive the best service possible.Owners:I've had the pleasure of meeting both of the owners of Casa La Femme.  Anastasi & Medhat.  Both are amazing people.  Anastasi is funny, a perfectionist, and he can DJ! He DJ'd one of the parties I threw at Casa La Femme.  Let me tell you, he is an owner that parties hard! I love him!  He is a truly amazing person.  Medhat is very detail oriented and extremely professional.  Whenever there was an issue at one of my events, he made sure it was handled.  He is the go-to guy if you ever need anything done or address something.  Both Medhat and Anastasi want to make sure you receive the best service, food, and experience at their restaurant and will do anything to make you a happy customer.

The only reson i gave this place 1 star is for the good food (not wow either) otherwise they definitely deserve a ZERO star!!!! Our reservation was for 10:15 pm, they sat us toour table after one hour wait eventhough the place was empty (we went a Saturday night). Coktails are horrible,  service even worst!! We were looking forward for a nice middle eastern night, to see belly dancer never get to see the show. Word of advice, If you guys reading and thinking to come here,  i strongly recommend you to go somewhere else as it complete waste of time and money!! This place certainly deserve to be in my blacklist, such waste of time and money!!!!

Casa La Femme is an Egyptian restaurant in the Western edge of Greenwich Village. What sold me was the fact that the floors are covered by actual grass, which they have in spring and summer and replace weekly. Having my shoes off and sitting on grass made me feel like sitting at an outside bar at a country club. Once or twice per night they have a belly dancer who was nice and super interactive. The waitresses were friendly and explained some highlights of Egyptian food, which I enjoyed.The decor is luxurious and attracts a few cheesy guests who could have starred in A Night at the Roxbury, but the place is great.

The service is terrible.  We had to ask for charcoal only to NOT get it...from two different servers. Our server was busy hanging at the bar instead of tending to the table.  The response when we inquired about the charcoal was that they're working on it.  Um, do they have to mine it?? Moroccan mint tea was good, though.  Along with the cocktails, including lemonada and qutbiscus.  No food was eaten.

This review is only for drinks and the bar experience. We needed a place to hide from the rain and this place sheltered us. The drinks were around $15 and pretty well made. The cool thing about the bar was the ground was lined with actual grass and there was a belly dancer walking around to keep the crowd entertained. I believe the dining room had swings and I can see this being good for an intimate gathering. All in all it was a 3 in my book.

I read all the good reviews and decided to make a reservation during the week over here with a bunch of my friends for two birthdays for that weekend, little did I know I was in for a big disappointment, I was given a call back the day of the reservation and was told each person had to pay for a pre-set menu. When I explained to the manager that on his website no where does it say that and we chose the a la carte menu, he didn't want to work out a compromise, was very rude, and told me he couldn't do anything about it and I should just cancel. I was sooo upset bc in a few hours all my guests were supposed to meet me there so my friend called the manager back and he worked out a $50 menu for everyone, and would seat us in a good place. When we got there we asked to sit by the main inner part of the restaurant and he the manager mentioned he has a lot of large parties coming in so we can put you in the back....meanwhile we were there for four hours and not a single party came in, there were over 5-6 large tables available and still they let us sat in the corner with bad angle. They served us free dips after waiting an hour for them, the food was okay nothing special. The belly dancer was only out there for 5 mins! The hooka only came in one flavor!!!! Basically it was a disaster!!!!!! When the bill came they charged us the more expensive rate per person!! That's how they treated a party who spend almost $2000. I'll never go back!

I loved this place. The food was great, loved the hummus.Ambiance was amazing. I loved how the restaurant was arranged, definitely gave you a middle eastern feel. Great for a romantic dinner. It is a little pricey but it's worth it.

What can I say that others haven't?  First I am so happy to find a place that is a top notch environment sans pretentious NYC jerks.   Everyone was so pleasant, belly dancer was friendly and talented.  The food- loved everything!  The hummus trio was to die and the drinks were refreshing.  All the patrons were in such a great mood and my friends and I interacted with so many other tables.  It really felt like you were at a great dinner party with tons of easy to get a long with, new people.  Very worth coming out of your house and getting pretty.  Can't wait to visit again.

This is a very cool place for a date. It is elegant yet cozy. I went for a friends birthday on a Friday night. Another friend is a promoter there who was the one that made our reservations. We had a great time!They have a sexy and beautiful belly dancer dance in front of each table. Food is pretty good and superb service. You must try at least once and ask to dine in the back/main dining room where they have lovely and private tables enclosed with long drapes that create the perfect mood.Oh and they have Hookah

I went here for my birthday last ear and I loved it, I had the pre-fixe menu for 2 and I also got a special treatment from the bellydancer it's an awesome environment especially for a date, I think it's called a cabana im not sure but I was seted there with my mate and it was very romantic, I loved the food I would definitely go here again!
Fantabulous. Great environment. Feels sexy. Sexy drinks. Belly dancers. Hookah by West 4th!!!

About last night....Great place on the outside! first they crammed 12 people in a corner, one of my guest had to eat with half her body  at the table. They thought this was fine....taking our order took 20 mins, brining the food took 30 mins in between each course. The portions are so small the food needed to be timed better. The server kept walking by us and not being attentive as to why until we brought these details to his attention...we did not have a good time at all. They tried to make it up to us with bottles of Proceso?! Not a good experience at all!
We happened upon Casa La Femme and we had a wonderful time. Food was amazing, atmosphere fun and different we felt like we were on vacation. Heading back saturday night! can't wait,

Came here with high expectations, but was very disappointed.I found out about this place through OpenTable when it was featuring one of those 30$ for 60$ worth of food. My friend and I decided to go with the Prix Fixe menu to experience being in a private 'tent', which really wasn't worth it. First came the pita bread with dip, which was probably the best part of the meal. Next I had the Goulash Bil Gibnah, an Egyptian pastry stuffed with leeks, mushrooms and herbs - that was okay. The grilled fish of the day had WAY too many BONES, tiny, small and large! It was like a minefield, where I was having to maneuver away from bones and spit them out after every bite.Lastly, the dessert was the biggest letdown. There were no choices to pick from, so my friend and I were both served the same pudding (tasted like quick mix) dish with a few slices of fruit place on the side.We finished dinner around 9 and wanted to at least see the belly dancers who had not yet come in. The waiter asked if we wanted more wine, to which we declined. Then we asked him when the belly dancer(s) was coming in and he said in 15 minutes. After about 5 minutes, the hostess came to tell us we had to leave our table, because there were others waiting. Um, actually, NO, the place was pretty EMPTY? Just because we didn't want to waste more money on drinks and crappy service, we were forced to leave. She actually had the nerve to say we could just stand in the lobby and wait for the belly dancer to arrive!Don't WASTE your money on crappy food, prices and service!!The interior isn't even that nice...the pictures online are very deceiving. PS. When the waiter asks if you'd like flat or sparkling water, make sure you say TAP water unless you want to pay 9$ + tax and tip for a bottle of water...

3.5 star will do it justice.Went here Friday night with few friends for drinks and dinner. I was impressed as I walked in. The place is huge and gorgeous. They have done a great job decorating it so well. Until our table was ready, we hung out in their pretty spacious bar with the friendly bartender. I ordered a dirty martini and my friends got negroni and the house special cockails from their elaborated cocktail list. We were given a choice of sitting in their private booths with prefix menu, but we decided to decline that offer. We got a bottle of tempranillo the bartender reccomended for the table. It was pretty delicious. The food was definitely not cheap compared to the taste and portion they served. The servers weren't the most attentive either. They missed out on one of our main course items and didn't bring it out until the rest of the table was done eating. For appetizers, we got the babaganoush and Goulash bil Gibnah. They were mediocre. The Tagine Alexandria was pretty good, but hardly any seafood. They had branzino for fish of the day, that was delicious. Two of my friends got the 'Riash Mashway'(the lambchops). This dish arrived extra late, but they looked like they enjoyed it. The belly dancer on the other end was pretty entertaining. I even got up and danced with her for a min. The place was nice enough to check it out once, but I do not plan to make another trip.

This place is SO far (and expensive). I was coming from Midtown and after walking a good 15 mins, I was contemplating on turning around and taking my butt home. Once I finally arrived, I was blown away by the venue. It was absolutely GORGEOUS! I had an appetizer and a drink -- I wasn't blown away by either of them. I'm thinking Casa La Femme is hype more than anything else.

I took my bf here for a birthday celebration. I called days earlier and booked seat with the canopy over, i literally arrived 5 minutes late and they gave my spot to someone else. The decor is very nice and unique, very themed and music was nice. The food was amazing excellent except for the main entree the chicken wasn't cooked well enough & my pita bread was hard and not fluffy like another reviewer posted. Price: VERY HIGH! Especially the drinks. The bellydancer: She was okay, i've seen better.

My 3 stars are for decor and entertainment. This place has a great atmosphere with moderate volume music in the background and comfortable cushioned chairs. Though the belly dancers don't come out often, when they do, they are beautiful and friendly and well worth the wait! We had a birthday boy in the group and she spent a good few minutes dancing with him and taking photographs with us! So why the lack of stars? The service, though it seemed friendly at first, was terrible. The waiters seem to have a deal for people who have special birthdays or events because then you'll get a small discount on the pre-fix menu. However, we arrived at 8:30 and didn't leave till 11. Our waiter completely disappeared on us for a good half hour. Instead his focus was on the huge table next to him. Our water wasn't filled until two hours after we sat down, and the food came out 45 minutes after the appetizer. Dessert took another 45 minutes after the table was cleaned. When it came to the bill we asked two times, and in return they asked US 3 times "did you get the bill yet?"  How strange!  After we got up ready to leave the waiter leaned over the balcony to the center of our table to reach the bill. I would give less stars but I don't think it would be fair to base the reviews on 1 or 2 waiters. My suggestion is to teach the waiters a little more manners and customer service quality and I'm sure the reviews would be better rated. Oh, the food itself is okay. We each ordered different appetizers and entrees to get a sense of the food overall. The chicken is really juicy and the beef appetizer is flavorful. Other than those two the others didn't stand out.
It's a cool spot aesthetically but the management is terrible. Some crazy manager was always running around. Over priced.

Overall disappointing experience. It took them 30 min to seat us even though we had reservations and there were so many empty tables. The wait staff is thoroughly confused as to which table they're waiting on. Only had appetizers (which were good) and wine with hookah, so can't speak for the main course. The place is nice, but you're definitely not fully getting your money's worth here.
Incredible atmosphere! Celebrated my best friends birthdays here. Ladies night group of 8! The food is absolutely amazing!!!! I will definitely be back.

We have been to Casa La Femme in the past and had a really nice meal, but our last experience was completely different. First, there is not one single employee in the restaurant that is Egyptian (not a good sign). Our reservation was at 6:30 and we were promptly seated. It was a Sunday night, so we were one of only 3 tables. We ordered the prix fixe meal, and our first course was not brought to the table until 7:30. I was disappointed by the extremely small portion sizes. We got a couple tablespoons of each spread and a pita the size of a saucer. When we asked for more bread, we were charged extra. Our second course was no better. The soup was cold and when sent back to get it warmed up it took 15 minutes to get it back. Really? The main course was OK, but most came a la carte so we had to order additional sides. I had the lamb chops which were very well done/overcooked (not uncommon in Egyptian restaurants). The odd thing was they were served in a bowl with rice in the bottom. How do you cut meat in a bowl? The tagine was just OK, not worth the $10 up charge though. We also ordered grape leaves, which ended up being the tiniest I've ever seen! They were about the size of my pinkie finger.The dessert course was a trio of very small traditional desserts. The basbusa was dry, but there was a small dollop of ice cream which made it passable. We didn't get our tea until after the dessert. It took 30 minutes to get our tea. We finally figured out the reason behind the extremely slow service- they had a belly dancer performing at 9:15 and they wanted us to stay until then. I was irritated by this. We should be able to make that decision, not be held hostage to be audience to an entertainer. She was very good, and it was an enjoyable performance.My overall impression was the restaurant has nice ambience, but the portions were very stingy and service was slow. The prices were astronomic. Overall not worth the very high price.
This place was amazing. Ask for Mateo as your server, he won't disappoint. The pre fixed menu was perfect for first time guests. Will definitely come back over and over again.

I am new to reviews but had two experiences this weekend, one good and one bad, that made me inclined to start writing reviews -- this was the bad one.Short Version: Good food, but service was so horrendous that I won't be going back.As an Egyptian, I was very excited to try Casa La Femme. Unfortunately, unlike most Egyptians, no one in the restaurant understood what hospitality means; at every stage, we were met with issues from the generally unfriendly staff.Our group of five had to wait at the bar for around 20 minutes even though almost half of the dining room was empty when we were finally seated. Just minutes after being seated at a table by the hostess, we were told that we had to move to a different table because a large group was coming in, and they needed the table where the hostess originally seated us. Once we were actually looking at a menu, we had multiple issues with the waitstaff in terms of ordering and received and returned wrong drinks at least two times. To top it all off, we were barely through our dessert platter for my 30th birthday when we were given the check and "reminded" that gratuity was not included. Then, moments after we paid, we were told we needed to leave because another reservation was coming in. This was despite the fact that we had overlooked the terrible service and tipped over 20% on a large bill of dinner and drinks. I was mortified! I couldn't believe that this was the type of place I chose to celebrate my birthday with family and friends who were visiting me in New York.It is a shame that all of the issues with service ruined what would have otherwise been a good meal. The food was great! The group was mostly Egyptian with others who are very familiar with Egyptian and Middle Eastern food. We all agreed that the food was authentic and delicious. The grape leaves and the branzino were especially tasty. The only caveat was that the portions were quite small, especially in comparison to the cost.All in all, I would have been excited to return to Casa La Femme for the food, but will never go back because of the service.

I really enjoyed my experience here. The service was excellent. The hookah was just okay. Drinks are a bit overpriced but I guess that's just nyc. Belly dancers were a lot of fun. Intimate ambiance. Great date night spot.
Wonderful restaurant, delicious food, and great service. A bit overpriced, fixed menu on weekdays

One of the worst dining experiences I've had in NYC. This place is a ripoff. We were a party of 11 and offered a prix fixe menu. When we inquired about a regular menu we were told that they didn't have one. The service was rude, and, when we returned food that was awful, they still charged for it. When we spoke to the manager about this, instead of being apologetic, he became incensed. HORRIFIC. Be warned.
5 stars because everything down to the decor was amazing. I loved this place! Great food, good service, lovely Decor and beautiful belly dancers. We had amazing birthday celebration!

This might be the worst place I have been too in a while. We were celebrating a friends birthday party. Our reservation was for 8:30 pm we were seated at 9:45. We finally got seated and my wine glass had lipstick marks so I asked for it to be replaced. We ordered our drinks and I ordered a diet coke no ice, I never got it. The food came out very slowly and at 11:45pm we still hadn't received our entrees.  My friend asked for a manager two times, he/she never came. She decided to go look for a manager and finally when he made himself available and we expressed our concern about the service he said we were the only table that complained and that everyone else was having a good time. We also expected a belly dancer show, the dancer did come out for like about 10 minutes and that was it. The atmosphere was crappy the service beyond disappointing I will never ever be back to this place.

Went here to celebrate my third year wedding anniversary with my husband. The food was so great. Loved the belly dancing show. We had the most romantic little canopied area that made the night so perfect. Their cocktails are especially yummy. Price wasn't really that bad. Not for a regular date night but definitely would go back to celebrate something special.

My table was suckered into doing the prix fixe menu. Huge mistake! For $60 a pop (plus an additional $8 if you wanted the lamb or fish), we got very bland, unexceptional food, and very little of it too - would it kill them to throw some rice on the side without charging an extra $7? I ordered the vegetable tagine and it consisted of carrots and barely cooked green pepper. I was promised eggplant but it was nonexistent. I could've gotten something 10x better for under 15 bucks from any takeout joint. The appetizers were good but the dessert was a very underwhelming small pastry. Overall, we got jipped - on taste and value. I'll never forgive the friend who recommended this place to us.Oh, and let's not forget the waitress who tried to upsell us on absolutely everything! She'd make a good used car salesman.

Came here last night for a birthday party as the birthday girl wanted to see a live belly dancer.  Here is my breakdown:PROS:1) Gorgeous place.  Decor and seating is phenomenal.  Great for a romantic dinner for two.  But had a great time with a party of 11.2) Since we had a large party we could only order a pre-fix (4 courses $60) Not too outrageous for NYC3) Food was decent.  I have had better hummus, pita, etc.  The Lamb Chops on the other hand.....probably the best I have ever had.  They are the only reason why this place doesn't get a one star. YES THEY ARE THAT GOOD!!!4) Belly dancer and the music was pretty good.  Kept us entertained.CONS:1)The customer service was probably the worse I have ever experienced for the price point.  2) About 1/3 of the glasses and/or silverware were dirty on the table.  3) Bathrooms were untidy and not as clean as I would expect.4) Wait staff was very inattentive.5) Dessert was deplorable.....Actually it was an insult to the 4 course menu.  It just does not belong. It's like it was an after thought.  The entire table was displeased with the dessert.6) I asked for my left over food to be wrapped up.  Some how since they liked me so much, they decided to give me a bonus and give me someone else's chicken.  NO ONE AT OUR TABLE HAD CHICKEN!!!!  EWWWWWWWW..........................7) After complaining, they gave me a new dish to take home.  I checked it again and it looked okay, but when I got home to re-heat it I notice some doughy like items in my jasmine rice.  I am absolutely  DISGUSTED.I'm DONE........(drops the mike and walks away)

How could I forget to rate this place? I went to Casa La Femme during the spring of last year. It was a great time from start to finish. First and foremost I loved the green grass on the floor. I loved the drinks, the hookah. I loved the food and of course the service. It was exceptional....... the belly dancer was awesome also. I would definitely go back probably in the spring again.

Beware, if you go on a "slow" day like when I took my friend there on Monday, I was extremely disappointed to find that they only had the front room (the bar/lounge) available for seating. I took her there for her birthday and was expecting the magnificent main dining room in the back. I understand that on a slow day, its not efficient to utilize the main room, but I basically paid the same price and got less experience sitting near the bar. Food was great, service was great, entertainment was amazing, but I will never go back on a slow day. Only go on Thursday, Friday, Saturday.

So me my boyfriend and I decided to try this place on Valentines Day. They had a special pre-fix menu for couples for $100 per person, great price we thought. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and seated very quickly, the ambiance was beautiful. Lets get right to it tho...so this menu was NOT only short with options but whatever we chose we had to SHARE!!!!!! While this may seem like a great idea for Vday its NOT realistic hello...um and at $100 per person we don't wanna share shhhh!!! He's a beef lover and im a fish lover! Not to mention the portions weren't even large enough to share! We walked out HUNGRY and ended getting food elsewhere. The starter plate was 3 pieces of pita bread and hummus- pretty ok, the 2nd course we chose was the meat option 1 beef and 1 chicken kebab with two sausages - mediocre and not enough for two people. For the main course we had lamb with an extremely small bowl of beans and potatoes that were HORRIBLE!!!...anyone who thinks this food was "great" I seriously question their palette. This was so not worth the price oh and to put the cherry on top of the cake for dessert TWO chocolate covered strawberries lmfaooo...

This was an excellent rest in terms of service & authentic Egyptian food. We called & we told we did not need reservations. when we arrived we were told by the host/manager to take a seat at the bar & he would get to us when he could...what??When I told him we tried to make reservations earlier he cut me off saying he had a phone call & would get to us when he was finished.  My husband & I were stunned!  The place was practically empty!  One of the waiters tried to seat us & the manager told us to get up out of our seats & wait at the bar!  At this point it took everything to not walk off but my husband really wanted to try this place. The manager was over the top unprofessional. If he had something better to do he should have had someone take his place to accommodate guests. Once seated the food was amazing & our waiter was so friendly & accommodating. We highly recommend this place for authentic Egyptian cuisine Hopefully the manager stays behind his desk & doesn't have to be among restaurant patrons to keep return customers.

Beautiful decor and, a very Arabic ambiance. For a more romantic dinner I would recommend a tent, however the menu is prix fixe. If you're looking for a lively night make reservations for when the belly dancer is performing or friday/Saturday when the DJ is there. Don't come here starved, portions are not large, but the food is delicious!

I must start by acknowledging the fact that this restaurant has the sexiest vibe imaginable.The decor is so ornate and there is so much attention paid to every detail.  The bathroom was even gorgeous, with floor to ceiling walls plastered with hand laid stones.  I hear in the summer the open the front up and bring in sod so it's like the bar area is actually atop a plush green lawn. Oh, and did I mention there's a belly dancer?  Like I said, sexiest vibe ever.... hot date? first date? need a lil' help to get that bow-chika-wow-wow?? This is your spot.The food's pretty good.  I happen to be a fan of Middle Eastern food, and I really enjoyed it.  For the most part it's simple and traditional, nothing too innovative and creative, so while I find myself unable to rave about it, I do want you to know that it is very enjoyable and skillfully prepared.I look forward to my next visit! :)
This place was amazing... I loved the belly dancing. I would give it a 5 stars but the food was only decent...very small portions. I will definitely go again!

Beautiful decor, good service, belly dancers, and you can smoke hookah while having din.1) Hummus-- okay2) Babaganoush-- good3) Fuul medames(puréed fava beans)-- okay4) Mousaka-- good5) Tagine khodar-- good6) Roz Bil Molokhya(rice cooked with green leaf soup)-- very good7) Peasant salad-- okay

I want to give this place 3 and a 1/2 stars but it's not possible. This venue is Egyptian  and Greek owned. The decor is Egyptian to the T. The food is amazing! The belly dancers are on point. But if you're Muslim, I'm sorry to tell you that they do serve alcohol here. You mostly see a lot of tourist looking people and I saw a couple of cross-dressers. If that's your thing, then this place is for you! Our server was excellent. She noticed that our waiter was also attending to a party of 20 and immediately took over. We never had to wait long for any order. They also have shisha but I believe they're limited in flavors, so do call in advanced.

I went to this restaurant a week ago for a friend's birthday party.  We had a really great time.  We had a 9pm reservation for a party of 17.. Unfortunately, not everyone arrived on time.  We thought that they weren't going to seat us, but they did which helped us a lot because some people didn't arrive until 11.  The decoration of the restaurant is amazing.. You feel like you're in a different world.  Very romantic setting and the tents are beautiful! Music was great and the belly dancers definitely made it worth going!  Food was really good.. I had the crab cakes and lamp chops.. I definitely recommend them!  Overall.. We had great service, a great waiter (Travis!) and a really great birthday for my friend.. Thanks Casa la femme!

I am very sympathetic towards establishments that might not get everything right, but at least genuinely try to make their customers happy.  But when you treat your customers as disdainfully as Casa La Femme does, you deserve the reviews that you get.My friend made a reservation for his girlfriend's birthday dinner at Casa La Femme.  We had a reservation for a party of 28.  They gave us a corner that maybe fit 18 at best.  So that is already a bad start.  But of course when you have a corner that fits 18 and you are trying to add 10 seats, you will need extra chairs, and extra place settings.  Because the service was slow/unattentive/uncaring, we were forced to walk around the dining room and ask other customers if they had extra chairs we could borrow.  We also had to grab extra place settings and silverware off of other tables, as multiple requests for items from the waitstaff went unanswered.  What we eventually had was a refugee-camp like experience, of 28 people stuck in a cramped space, crawling over the banquets to get to the bathrooms.The food was mediocre.  For a $60 prix fixe menu, you get: a mezze platter, with an average of about 1 x 3 oz portion of baba ganoosh, hummus and something else per 3 people, and 1 small pita per 2 people.  Then you get a choice of a vegetarian stuffed thing in phylo dough (which was the best thing we had), overcooked sausage, or octopus which you would pay extra for.  Then you get a choice of other overcooked meats for your 3rd course, or a vegetarian tagine that is really, really not good at all.  There was supposed to be desert with our prix fixe as well, but that never came, and after 3.5 hours of being cramped in an uncomfortable space eating mediocre food, we decided it wasn't worth an extra 30 minutes of trying to flag down our waitress to try desert.The belly dancing show that happens once every 4 hours (and I know that that is how frequent it is because we got to experience it at the very beginning of the meal, and then as we were trying to leave) was actually really good and entertaining.  That is about the only good thing I can say for this place.  Casa La Femme is one of those places you get stuck going to because you wait till the last minute to make a reservation for a large party on a Saturday night.  But please people, do yourselves a favor!  Plan a couple of weeks in advance and make a reservation at a restaurant that at least tries to create a good experience for large parties.

Absolutely beautiful restaurant. I mean really, the decor...over the top gorgeous. So ornate. Rose petals and mirrored chandeliers up the wazoo! Not as busy as it should be, which may be a good thing when trying to make reservations.Beautiful belly dancers put on a show, and the tasting menu is a great value!I happen to be an Octopus fiend and let me tell you, the Octopus is incredible here!Have been here a couple times for my engagement and my fiancé's 30th, each time with large groups and it worked out very well. Cute little cabana style seating makes for a very intimate night if you so-choose!

Excellent atmosphere with romance lingering in the air.  Well decorated and fully packed on a Saturday night.  That's what should be expected on a weekend in NYIt was my best buddy's birthday.  We celebrated with good food and good drinks.  I heard the bar was doing a 10% donation to a good cause.  My best buddy will be running a 5 day marathon from New York to Washington.  Here's to you!  Chi-ching for your charity group!

Food is great, way over priced, but youre paying for the environment and the general aesthetics of the restaurant.SERVICE SUCKS. it is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. The servers move to the largest tables and they are severely understaffed. so if you come in with another person, youre left behind for a table of 8 people. 2 people- 2 drinks total and regular appetizers and meals, no dessert = $160.$80 per person. one drink each. Wow.The drinks are $15 each. Maybe we should have done the prix fix menu for $60 - but I dont know what was included.We had the lamb kabob (3 of them) great.The lamb chops were OK.The fish was OK.DO NOT GET THE RICE with pita in it, $7 FOR a tiny portion!I wont be back.

For any body to say this food is bad. Your not a real foodie. This food was so good. And I did feel things that could of been change but over all. The food and service was great. And yes I could see if it's a crazy night here it may take a long time. That's what's good about a place like this!  Don't rush just enjoy life and food. I'll be back. With the food gang.

Very disappointed. First they told us they were out of octopus.  After we ordered the main course they came back to tell us they were out of lamb chops, which many of us had ordered. The service wasn't great as we waited a very long time for our food.  On a more positive note the place was very nice and they did take money off the bill to compensate us for not having what we really wanted. Only 2 stars for this sub par dining experience.

My favorite date spot! Something different, super friendly and warm service, good food presently beautifully, romantic ambiance, delicious drinks, normal nyc prices, and belly dancers everyone should go at least once!  I do suggest making a reservation and requested a tent booth.

I pretty much loved this place! It looked beautiful, stylish & expensive. The staff was not only nice, but also extremely cooperative!!! The food was very very tasty. My mouth was very happy... This place is a go for Gluten Free Vegatarians!They also had a belly dancer entertaining us during dinner. Man at my table were quite excited lol I give it 5 stars as it fully deserves it!!!

This is a review that should have been made sooner. I visited this spot almost a year back so things may have changed.About a year back, I went here for a girl's night with my lovely roomies. We had made reservations of the white tents. Ambiance: Sultry, sexy, swankyDrinks: exotic, delicious but pricey.Entertainment: This is where it gets its' most stars. The belly dancer from that night. OMY. She was so damn good. If you come here make sure there is belly dancing going on! She really got the crowd going!Seating: here's where it loses the point. I had specifically inquired about the white tent. All that entailed was told to me. But upon arrival I was informed that EACH member of the party apparently had to do a prix fixe.  So in a group of four if three people are doing a prix fixe and one isn't that is not allowed. Thus we weren't given the tent. See I think that was ridiculous. That tent would have easily been given to a couple. We had at least 2 people out of our group of four ready to do a prix fixe! So instead we seated at a regular table which I begrudgingly have to admit was a fairly nice alternative. Food: It's tasty. But portions are small. So keep it in mind. HOOKAH: is served here! $35 practically no flavor options. BUT it is served here!I have to say we loved the experience at this place. We knew we'd have to part with a pretty penny that night but that was the whole plan anyways. A night of awesome fun and a little indulgence. It was great!P.s. it's also a great date spot. Anniversary. Those private tents really are romantic and amazing.

Rose! Rose! Rose! That great hostess turned what could have been a disaster into the best night in a very long time. We made the reservation for 8 with her the week before. When three of us arrived together, someone else "helped" us and found no record of the reservation. "No problem," she says, "just sit at the bar (NOT in view of the belly dancers), and when everyone is here we'll seat you." Pet peeve: other people saying NO PROBLEM when it IS a problem. Minus one star for that!After a bit of masculine whining, we got a table just down a short set of stairs from the dancers. Better, but it was a real neck strainer seeing the action. Then comes Rose! "Hey you guys," she says, "come on upstairs where the action is."She gets us a table in the main room, the belly dancer comes over and it's all uphill from there. Rose wasn't even mad because the other 5 people I'd promised didn't show. It is a great place. The belly-dancing is just the icing on the mid-Eastern cake. The food was delicious. We had the seafood tagine... which wasn't served in a tagine, There were only two GIANT shrimp, but the seasoning was perfect. Likewise we had the pita with various toppings, all excellent. On the pricey side (cost us $60 each with no wine (only beer), and only one main course. But the food and service were excellent. It was excellent. Plus, there was ROSE!!! --Drink Club NYC is a roving group of NY drinkers. A different bar every week.

Casa La Femme  - three stars because service was TERRIBLE!!!!Amazing decor! Good food.Drinks good - wine menu very selective. Alittle disappointed because I enjoy wine)Again service TERRIBLE.  The dessert menu wasn't offered to us, and we had to chase down the waitress for our bill. The tent we were seated was very dark, and didn't have a chandelier (horrible).  We couldn't see our food, and had to ask for additional candles and use our phone as light.  Not sure if I will go back....Oh and our waters were not refilled often....TERRIBLE too.

I came here totally spontaneously and really enjoyed it! I was in NYC for a conference and had some time to the kill in the evening. A fellow conference attendee was in the same boat, so we walked around and decided to try this restaurant for an early dinner. The first thing I noticed when I walked in was the atmosphere -- it was pretty quiet and simply but elegantly decorated; I particularly noticed the round mirrors that reminded me of portal windows on a boat.it was like i was in a different world. it was spectacular.im coming back.

Got there at 9:45 for a 10pm reservation. Stood by the hostess stand for over an hour with no where to sit and several clueless people including the hostess who said 5 more minutes 15x. Once we were sitting, it took 10 min to get menus and 30 minutes to get our drinks. My friend had glass in her drink. We asked for manager and he gave us a crappy $10 bottle of champagne and said he'd take care of drinks. Waitress informed us she could only comp one drink. Food was ok, not great. We were there for over 3 hrs, Bill was 650 for 7 ppl and only had a cheap bottle of wine, and a drink each. Won't recommend. Million better choices.

We went to this place when they were still in midtown. We loved it. We went with the prefixed dinner and got one of those private tables with the drapes. Candle lit and romantic beyond words. The food is middle eastern so if you have never had this type of food it has alot of spices. We loved it. Now the service is completely awful so be prepared for that, but I think the food makes up for it so my review is judged solely on the food not the service. I don't believe in giving a place 1 or 2 stars because the service was off and they didn't kiss your ass. Remember your there for the food and the ambiance not the waiters.

I was skeptical coming here due to  the mixed reviews but our girls' night turned out to be so much spent here. The food was so flavorful and the service was impeccable. The manager, Luis, and the whole wait staff were so accommodating. The belly dancer was amazing. It was a little pricey but well worth it. We will definitely come back here with our spouses.

OK, I'm going to be the voice of dissent here because I love this place.This is an Egyptian restaurant, specifically, from the region of Alexandria, so this is what Euclid used to eat (trivia for the math fans out there).The service is impeccable, and by impeccable, I mean perfect in every way.  They treated us like royalty, and more importantly, extended every courtesy and respect to my wife.  They made her feel like a queen.  This is a place you definitely want to take your girlfriend; they pamper the ladies.  In addition, the waitstaff is knowledgeable of perfect restaurant etiquette.  They were attentive, but from a distance.  They don't hover over you in a misguided attempt to be zealously service-oriented.  They keep their distance and maintain eye contact.  A simple raise of the hand or an eyebrow will bring the waitstaff over.  Your private conversation is, well, private.  Furthermore, they're not in a rush to snatch your plates away from you when they think you're done.  They let you finish your meals together: a lost courtesy among restaurants.  They don't pick up your check until after you leave your table, another lost restaurant etiquette.   I don't even have a nit-picky bone to pick in the service department.Ambiance is perfect.  This place is BEAUTIFUL.  It looks like the inside of a royal palace, but importantly, it's not gauche or tacky.  The beautiful decor is tastefully done and perfect in every way.  If you order the prix fixe menu, you sit at a table with a white tent surrounding it that affords total privacy.  At the end of our dinner, my wife and I enjoyed Turkish coffee and a hookah with a supremely hot make-out session in total privacy.  The bathrooms are private and some of the best I've ever seen anywhere in the world.  The sensual smell of delicious hookah wafts subtly through the air and the lighting is perfect: dim enough to be very romantic but not so dim that you're squinting at your food.  You feel like you're on the set of Casablanca.The food is fine.  I wouldn't say this is one of the top food restaurants in NYC, however, I'd say the food is above average.  But if you're coming here, you're not coming for the food necessarily; you're coming for the entire experience.  A very hot, very sensual, very memorable experience with your lover.  I won't comment further on the individual dishes like I usually do because the food really isn't the point of coming here.  You're coming here for an awesome evening with your loved one.  Suffice to say that the food is delicious; I did not find it to be lacking as some reviews have claimed, in any way shape or form.Some reviews claim that the drinks are a nasty surprise, price-wise.  True, they don't tell you the price before hand, and they probably should disclose the price on a drinks menu.  however, $10-$12 for a large mixed drink is really not out of line for $55/plate restaurant.  It's about right.  Point of info: their signature drink is the lemonada, but I found that the tamarind drink was much better.  I was dubious at first because I'm not a big fan of tamarind, but I will concede -- it totally works.  Two thumbs up.My wife and I went here for our first anniversary.  They gave us flutes with champagne and a hookah gratis (free) for our anniversary.  I think the hookah is normally a bit pricey at $30, which is about $15 more than you'd pay elsewhere, but again, that's not a big markup for a place like this, and it's well worth the experience.  I very strongly recommend getting the hookah with Turkish coffee at the end of your meal.The belly dancer started at 9:30pm (we arrived at 7:30pm).  She was supremely hot!  She goes from table to table and puts on a 3-5 minute show for each table.  She dances with the ladies as well as men.  Even my wife thought she was smoking hot and started to blush when they danced.We paid $185 and I was moved by the perfect service to leave a 25% tip post tax.  In return, we were treated to a perfect evening, and by perfect, I mean truly perfect.  We will remember our first anniversary for years to come.  I couldn't have made a better decision on an anniversary venue.I would recommend the prixe-fixe menu for $55.  You get a private table with the cloth tent along with your dinner.  For those of you think it's too expensive, then I would suggest finding a cheaper restaurant.  Personally, my experience here was worth every single solitary penny that I spent.  It is the perfect date restaurant for those with a little extra money to spend.
HORRIBLE !!!!! Way over priced, the service sucks !!! So not worth it ...

Let me preface this review by saying that Casa La Femme is one of the most gorgeous restaurants I've been to. All of the decor, from the tables and chairs to the chandeliers and flowers are truly beautiful. Even the individual bathrooms are immensely spacious with armchairs in each one. The entire place has a very romantic feel to it, perfect for a date night or a girls night out. HOWEVER...... this is as far as my praise for this restaurant can go!I came here on a Saturday night with a group of 9 girls to celebrate a birthday. I had specified on open table and on the phone when they called to confirm that I did not want the tented seating because I wanted to be able to order a la carte. When we arrived, the waiter tried to push the prix fixe menu on us anyway. Clearly this is what management tells them to do. We chose a la carte and ordered the hummus, babaganoush, and fava bean mezzes for our apps. We also got the crab cakes and their supposedly famous peasant salad. The mezzes were the only good thing we ate all night. The crab cakes were subpar and that "famous" peasant salad was a total joke. I could've made that myself and made it better. We didn't fare any better when the entrees came. The lamb chops were overcooked, dry, and rubbery. The moussaka was bland and tasted nothing like its description. The vegetarian tagine was just as mediocre. The salmon was the only dish that was semi- decent. Overall, all of the food was pretty flavorless and felt like it was missing something.I would've loved to end the night at this point, but since it was so cold out and we didn't feel like walking to another spot, we decided to get 2 hookahs for the table. They only have 1 flavor which is apple (pretty ridiculous to not offer more variety than that). Now, I've had a lot of hookah in my life, but I have to say this was by far the absolute worst I've ever had. It tasted nothing like apple and actually had a licorice flavor to it. It was rough and tasted downright disgusting. In October I came here just for the hookah late on a Saturday night and we had a bad experience then too. At least it tasted like apple that time, but again it was poorly made and very rough. The hookah's are also really small, but they charge the same price that the larger ones are at other lounges. We complained and they did take 1 of them off of our bill. My friend also had a very bad experience with their restrooms. They have at least 6 or 7 individual bathrooms and all of them, while decorated beautifully, were not clean. They could certainly afford to keep an attendant there. A customer should not have to forego using your facilities because they're too dirty. I would like to make a note that the restaurant did call me a few days later and left a voicemail asking me for feedback on my experience. I did call back, but no one picked up. Needless to say, I will not be coming here again. Yes the decor and ambiance are certainly pretty, but at the expense of basically everything else? Sorry, but you'll have to find another sucker.

This place could have been a really great experience. The decor is beautiful and the food was pretty good. Even at the pre fixe 60$ price you get a decent amount of food and it is tasty. The belly dancer is a fun addition too. That being said, The service makes this place impossible to enjoy. Me and my girlfriend went on a date and had a reservation. We sat 20 minutes after our reservation which i just chalked up to a busy night. Then we sat for 40 minutes without even getting a menu. We asked several times and there were other tables all complaining of the same thing. I ordered drinks that never came and just never seemed like anyone cared except the one older guy who was bringing out peoples food. I assume he was a manager or owner.

Occasion: Friend's B-day bash. Venue:  overly decorated with chandeliers, velvet wooden seats, private tents, very pompous...with the crowd to match. DJ promoted a nice, clubby ambiance. Belly Dancer only showed up at 9 and 12am, wasn't too engaging, probably 'cause we were mostly a female table. At the bar waiting, paid $14 for a mediocre glass of white wine, the "best they had in the category". I had better wine from Tj's in my fridge. Poor wine choices me make angry. Like someone else mentioned, there is no bar menu with the list of prices, so be careful when ordering. On to food: seems like the only menu they have is $55 prix fix. Was dismayed by the small portions. Even the Pita bread with dips (w hummus, babaganoush, bean puree) was considered a "first course". You get 3 in one bowl, so in a crowd of 4-5, you're really eating 1/2 a bread minimum. It was very fresh and I felt it should have been available throughout the courses.2nd  course (really the appetizer) Ordered the Crabmeat Kofta Crab, basically consisted of two small crab meat patties...just that. it was OK. People who ordered the Felfel Mahschi (Jasmin rice) seemed more disappointed in their dish.3rd course: I paid the extra  $5  for the chopped lamb which turned out delicious. I'm glad they didn't screw it up, since lamb is a Middle Eastern specialty. Though I wish it came with a better side, other than plain white rice.Dessert (Baklava)  came in tiny portion but good. Service was mediocre. No water refills.  Average 15-20mn wait between courses. Dinner lasted roughly 3hrs. Overall the steep price you pay to eat is mainly for  the upkeep of this Arabian Aristocracy.

I really enjoyed this off the beaten path jewel.  The food was excellent and tasty and the service was top notch.  The decor is unlike anything I've seen before and the music was somewhat appropriate.  I totally recommend this place for a date or a group of trendy friends.
Ok, service mediocre as was the food. Mosquitos were rampant. Manager rudely yelling at staff in the open.

Awesome grub at a hidden gem on Charles St.  The drinks are a little pricey than I'd prefer but then again this Chic NYC and the ambiance makes up for it.  The food is amazing!  Nice chill spot.  Keep it up...

Dinner with a show! Last night was my third time dining at casa la femme. The food has always been delicious and last night was no exception. The belly dancers are both talented and kind, encouraging participation from the room. Casa la femme is great for date night, girls night out or even dinner with your parents. It should be noted, however, that is is not a place for quiet conversation as the music is quite loud throughout the meal.

Amazing! Beautiful decor and ambiance. Had my best friends bachelorette here on a Saturday night and everything was perfect. From the rose petals on table, to the belly dancers to the yummy food.  Pure sexiness all the way! Luis was fantastic and attentive. Our server Mario was a perfect gentleman that never left us waiting on anything! Would highly recommend planning a party here!

A very romantic rainy night was spent at this place recently. Food was definitely awesome (so awesome that I forgot to take a pic of the entrees since we started chowing down as soon as we got them!) and I fell in love with the decor! Service could have been better (had to wait 1/2 hour for our check) but I blame our waiter and not the restaurant because the waitress we had before him was awesome! May be it was the company or may be it was the ambiance or both but I had a great night here! The beautiful and more talented than usual belly dancer definitely added to it all! This place is more expensive than usual as well (a hookah costs $35 bucks) so I suggest it for that special occasion once in a blue moon :)On a side note: A lot of seafood entrees on the menu!

Food below average. Service wishes to be better. The prices are rip offs. The belly dancers are bad   On Valentine's they should of started at 7 pm she began at 845 pm. The place is not worth of the money they r charge

AYAYayy...just say that it is not cheap. between 8 ppl it was $65 each person. I even shared the lamb chops with my friend (which was cooked pretty awesome) and had one drink.  Although we just split it equally, I saw they charged ONE SHOT of vodka $14!! What!? We are not in a club, they didn't even give Grey Goose SMHHHH!I'm not going to lie, the lamb chop was good...but no side dishes included.  $28 for lamb chops ONLY.  And my drink was $20 each.  And I remember I had to wave down the waiter to order my entree as well, if I'm paying a lot I expect high end service.  And this place only gets that extra star because I really like their bathrooms and the belly dancer was really nice.
Cool atmosphere.   Great service and very tasty food.  The octopus was wonderful.  Go on a date or with friends.

I've been to Casa a number of times and have always enjoyed the experience.  I decided to bring a dear friend to the restaurant to celebrate his birthday.  I was really disappointed with the experience.  They put us in the smaller room, which is no where nearly as exciting as the main room.  They knew it was a special occasion and I had made reservations in advance - but they insisted there was no room.  Service was dodgy and we waited about 30-40 minutes for each drink.  They also forgot to bring out a candle for my friend's birthday cake.  Our server did try very hard, but the kitchen / bartender were a mess.

Overall, this place was great. We had reservations for 9PM but arrived at 8:30 and we were seated immediately. We did the Pre Fixe and enjoyed the tented seating. The belly dancer was enjoyable as well. Food was great. All four courses. Wait staff were knowledgable helped us make our decisions. Drinks were on point. Overall, great atmosphere.

I was here for the tail end of a day-long bachelorette party that started with a trip to several Long Island vineyards. By that time, I was pretty tired and had had my fill of drinking. But I was pleasantly surprised by the vibe of this restaurant/ lounge. I'd be lying if I said I could remember exactly what I ate because truth be told, the bachelorette party was a few years ago.What I can remember vividly was the enchanting decor that made me feel like I was Egypt, leisurely dining on yummy food (I think I had the tagine, but again I'm not positive) while enjoying some fun entertainment. As a latin and ballroom dancer myself, I have a deep appreciation for all types of dance. And since I did at one point begin taking belly dance classes (until my salsa instructor told me it would interfere with her teachings, but that's another story), I was all the more enthralled by the beauty with which Casa La Femme's dancers executed what I consider to be one of the most beautiful dances there is. I had mentioned the vibe earlier. It's difficult to put into words, except to say that your time at Casa La Femme will be a sensory experience from the moment you walk in. In the main dining room, the central seating area sits on a slightly sunken level, with a large fire pit serving as the focal point of the whole restaurant. Flanking this area on an elevated level are tables partially covered in organza-white tents, with hand-laid glass tiles on the floors and authentic Egyptian woodwork adorning the walls. The restaurant is filled with the smells of herbs and meats cooking, and though your dining companions are obviously super fun people, you'll enjoy the distraction when the music is pumped up and those dancers get out into the dining room, engaging men and women alike to create a communal sense of celebration. The one thing that marred my experience had nothing to do with the restaurant - I somehow managed to totally get screwed into paying $100 in a table of, like, 10 girls, even though I had an appetizer and entree with no drinks at all. Again, not the restaurant's fault, but when I do return, I'll be paying with cash ... and going with a smaller group.

Three of us went on a Wednesday evening. Beautiful setting, quiet, with delicious food and very attentive, quick service.Two of us are vegetarians, and we had hummus, babaganoush and fuul medames with sesame pita, grape leaves, baked baby peppers and phyllo pastries for mazzas and appetizers. And for our main course, we had vegetarian moussaka. All dishes were excellent. (Another reviewer said they only got one piece of pita for 5 people, but we got 4 pieces for 3 of us.)Our companion was Egyptian. She had the molokhya (a green leaf soup) and the chicken. She liked both but didn't think they tasted traditional.  She approved of the pita and other mazzas.We all shared the dessert plate, with baklava (a couple chocolate covered ones as well) and two other desserts. We had already eaten too much to really appreciate the desserts, and I didn't really care for the baklava.I look forward to returning to this lovely restaurant. The food was wonderful, and there is so much variety for a vegetarian/vegan.

I'm Egyptian and a huge fan of Casa La Femme.  It's so sophisticated, yet not at all pretentious.  It reminds me of a restaurant I love in Cairo (Zamalek) called Abou El Sid because of the authentic Egyptian platters and the incredibly elaborate decor.  Take a minute to walk around.  You will see is some of the most beautiful Egyptian furniture, architecture, and design that you won't find anywhere else.   On to the food:  I highly recommend the Ful Medames as an appetizer.  It's seasoned so damn well and it comes with warm fresh house made Egyptian bread (not toasted Toufiyan's pita!).   The grilled octopus and goulash were awesome too.   My favorite main courses were the lamb chops and samak tagine. Drinks are on the pricier side, but not relative to other high end places in high end neighborhoods.  This place is beautiful and I always see gorgeous interesting women at the bar so I'm not complaining.

This place is a poorly operated joke. The wine selection is mediocre at best and I hope their sommelier sees this and alters their selection.
